column1: luther:please update GB calculation scripts:ITE-1708
column26:
please update in calculation custom scripts the GB logic as per ITE-1708

Root cause is configuration. The EMS holds only one custom calculation block - valid for all countries:

!_SA_EMS config.png|thumbnail!

That means this block is used for all countries (DE and UK alike)

Inside this block many DE specific validators are used.

That works well for Germany as the not covered parts of the custom calculation fall back to the corresponding DE market template

All employees located in {color:#de350b}UK {color}whereas - fall back to the {color:#de350b}UK {color}market template - that means you are combining {color:#de350b}DE {color}validations with {color:#de350b}UK{color} calculations (which does not work at all)

error:

!image-2023-04-03-08-40-01-794.png!

UK needs to be proper configured - you cannot simply use half UK template and DE custom calculation. 

+*Follow up:*+

Set up UK properly - make the custom calculation block country specific

column26:
Hello team,

Error:
!image-2023-03-16-19-19-57-320.png!

We have that role you can access the EMS from the management tab.
In the EMS you open the "advanced system settings" block and add the following setting in the system properties:

Afterwards your system will use the EMS for calculations.

column1: Allianz - Double Budgeting, pdf report remove line "Mahlzeitenversteuerung über die Gehaltsabrechnung"
column26:
Dear Team,

Currently for the configuration "Double Budgeting", when user travels by car and add the kilometers done, they have a "Payment of tax for meal via payroll" because after 20km done the amount change to 0,38€ instead 0,30€ per kilometer.

After verification, it appears that this difference is allowed by the German government and it's not taxable.

I did a test in staging and the line "Mahlzeitenversteuerung über die Gehaltsabrechnung" (Payment of tax for meal via payroll) is not sent in the export (see attached)

So I assume that it's only shown in the pdf report.

Please could you remove it ?

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra
column201:
server: Amadeus 
System: ama-de-allianz
Configuration: Double Budgeting

column291:
21/Feb/23 10:00 AM;nsanchez;client notes>

For clarification:

1) If the company pays the costs, then it must be mapped to a wage type starting with 9.

In this example, the company pays for the flight. This means that the correct wage type is 961Z. There are no alternatives with regard to sales tax.

2) If the employee pays the costs, then a wage type starting with 8 must be mapped.

Only here is the wage type selected according to the amount of sales tax.;;;

column1: Vaillant -  Automatically overwrite tax rate
column26:
Hello team,

Customers report that the tax rate is automatically overridden.
I had opend the ITE-1601. so Could you please adjust the tax rate on configlation of "fullallowance".

<Root cause>
The behavior is caused by missing tax definition in the Engine
The tax rate on this booking is 'Reduced2' rate visible in the UI which corresponds to technical code 'expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reduced_4
This rate is defined in Vegas configuration for country SK and PT for receipt type 'expense.basereceipt.receipt.hotel'

SK
!image-2023-02-15-10-27-00-034.png!


On Engine side the used configuration is 'fullallowance'. However in those configuration files there is no Accounting Configuration included. Hence, we are taking the information from the default configuration and this one does not have the mentioned tax rate defined.
!image-2023-02-15-10-25-09-862.png|width=1062,height=307!

Tax rate:
!image-2023-02-15-10-26-12-725.png|width=1000,height=526!

Best regards,
Yutaka

DE location:

              <taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reduced"/>

              <taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.1600"/>
              <taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.0500"/>

Could you please add tax rate on engine config.

DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.none~0.0
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reduced~0.07
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regular~0.19

Beat regards,
Yutaka

column1: Investigate and fix the script error in the ama-es-ch system on production
column26:
Hello Codebusters,

when I checked our engine logs on kibana prod I noticed the occurrence of multiple rg.graalvm.polyglot.PolyglotException in the ama-es-ch system.

TypeError: invokeMember (setCostCenter) on net.ifao.expense.customScripts.wrapper.PostingRecordWrapper(...)failed due to: Cannot convert '0'(language: Java, type: java.lang.Integer) to Java type 'java.lang.String': Invalid or lossy primitive coercion.

The execption is thrown during the addVehicleDebitPostingRecord method call in the first js script in the ExpenseData hook of the postingRecordGeneration phase in the custom logic configurations in the location country GB.

Please fix the error.
 * System:           ama-es-ch
 * Country:         GB
 * Phase/Hook:   postingRecordGeneration/ExpenseData
 * Subactor:        net.ifao.expense.logic.customSubActors.CustomScriptSubActor
 * KibanaLogs example:
        https://es.secure.ifao.net/s/ee/app/kibana#/doc/3afe1f90-e0e8-11ec-b748-a7b709a9fb27/ee.1-2023.04/doc?id=U4jI5IUBugrCUMgQcxEO&_g=

 ;;;

30/Jan/23 1:27 PM;nsanchez;[~dykiert] 

 

overnight stay for client is that traveler spends the night in the ES

example:

 

1feb 0900-2feb 1200

overnight stay

 

1feb 0900-2300 / 2feb 0900-23

no overnight stay because itinerary is broken (must spend the night)

column299:
31/Jan/23 12:24 PM;nsanchez;[~dykiert] 

example:

 

2 Feb. with overnight stay 619
3 Feb without overnight stay 621
The trip is a 2-day trip with one overnight stay, so the first day is a per diem with overnight stay (619) and the return day is a per diem without overnight stay (621). 

It must be taken into account that with overnight stay it has to be until 0:00 or full day and,  Without overnight stay until 23:55;;;

column1: EH:increase custom script size limitation/ITE-1475
column26:
dear team as per ITE-1475 please :
code into the custom script a size limitation, for warning messages

ref:

+*ssue as reported:*+

Generic error on a specific statement during calculate action

+*Labels:*+

SAExp:iConf - the statement is inoperable by invalid configuration

+*Root Cause:*+

Multiple warning fields are stored in this statement wit too-large-content. This specifc case resembles ITE-1178. A field non-existing in ce-core is returned by the engine. Thus it is stored as Link. Links have a size limit in the Database smaller than the content:

!_SA_NG Error_Link too long.png|thumbnail!

Above the corresponding NG error.

Here is the Engine calculation response: [^13181003_response.xml]

In short - the calculate is functioning, but ce-core is not able to store the result, cause the result contains too many characters for the link.

The issue is caused by changing the configuration of the warnings FDF retrospectively during the lifetime of this statement.

column1: AUDI - Wrong statements calculation
column26:
Dear Team,

Following the ITE-1289, it seems that the reimbursment amount is not properly calculated.

e.g.: 7799370

 

!image-2022-12-13-15-13-04-812.png|width=404,height=154!

 

+Must be:+

'Sachbezugswerte ...': 10,71 -> this amount is informational only and is not used for calculation

'Summe ...': 87,14 -> is the sum of all receipts - paid by company and paid by Traveler

'Zwischensumme': 87,14 -> is the sum of everything above (mileage, accommodation, receipts) but without the part 'Sachbezugswerte ...'

Abzüglich ...': 7,14 -> is minus the receipts paid by company

'Erstattungsberag...' 80,00 -> the reimbursment amount

 

Please could you verify and fix?

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: porsche:ITE-1383 - update configuration for receipts
column26:
as per ITE-1383 we need to adapt configuration so in the mobile app they have the same receipts as in the desktop

*current:* only 31 receipts available in mobile app (34 available in cytric desktop)

*target:* same receipts available in cytric should be available in mobile

 

+required in configuration as per ITE:+

 

the configuration is setup to use configuration of type Code and a Location default.
In the Code Configuration 'Business Trip' we have numbered 34 receipt types. In the Code Configuration 'Collective Statement' we have no receipts defined.
In the Location Configuration, we have numbered 31 receipt types plus on receipt for 'Company Car Load'.
Different to Desktop where on Statement Creation, you select the correct configuration (Business Trip / Collective Statement) you do not have this option when capturing receipts. Hence, in this case Mobile will use the Location receipts in your given scenario

+*Follow up:*+
Either change the configuration to avoid working with Code configuration or ask Mobile PM for a timeline if and when to change the behavior in Mobile

column1: allianz:invalid type of receipt
column26:
as per ite-1386 we must correct:

The receipt type - in the receipt type block of the EMS config for ABV is named "{_}exp{color:#de350b}ne{color}se.basereceipt.receipt.{color:#de350b}allianz.{color}mvv.fee{_}" 

Due to typo and additional _"allianz."_ in the EMS config the system cannot find the EMS settings for the receipt type. 

I also find it personally bad practice to put no labels/translations into the EMS. It is true that the labels are still loaded from the CE-Core configuration and not from the EMS, but for completeness, readability and for avoiding errors after the migration I would prefer to see also labels/translations in the EMS.

Der-co-init complains that the calculation of the calculation of the §4(5) EStG 30% amount is wrong because it doesn't include the TIP.

 

In the example below you can see that only the entertainment is splitted into 70/30.

100 EUR - 15,97 EUR (tax) = 84,03 EUR

Please could you fix?

This customer has already EMS, I don't know if it's something that could be fix in EMS but if it's the case, please explain the steps to correct and like this BAYANI Team will do it in the future.

 

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: SEAT - Not working export transfer for attachment and report
column26:
Hello team.

I opened the ITE-1258. Dorren mentioned to me that the attachment and report descriptor need to be in a <findUnit>
Could you please adjust the descriptor and folder.

1. Adjust the descriptor
{color:#de350b} *(I mask the sensitive part of the sftp path.*{color}
{code:java}
      <dataFieldDescriptor code="expense.attachments.ftp.url" type="Text" feature="${CYTRIC_EXPENSE_BUSINESS_CODE}">
        <nameTranslation>
          <name locale="en_US">External ftp url for expense attachments</name>
          <name locale="en_GB">External ftp url for expense attachments</name>
          <name locale="de_DE">External ftp url for expense attachments</name>
          <name locale="pt_PT">External ftp url for expense attachments</name>
          <name locale="es_ES">External ftp url for expense attachments</name>
        </nameTranslation>
        <assignTo>
          <assign type="${CLASS_TimedConfiguration}" />
        </assignTo>
      </dataFieldDescriptor>
      <findUnit>
        <fdfs>
      <FDF code="expense.attachments.ftp.url">
        <item value="sftp://xxxxxxxxx@sftp-dmz.secure.ifao.net/ama-es-seat/exports" />
          </FDF>
        </fdfs>
      </findUnit> 

     <dataFieldDescriptor code="expense.reports.ftp.url" type="Text" feature="${CYTRIC_EXPENSE_BUSINESS_CODE}">
        <nameTranslation>
          <name locale="en_US">External ftp url for expense reports</name>
          <name locale="en_GB">External ftp url for expense reports</name>
          <name locale="de_DE">External ftp url for expense reports</name>
          <name locale="pt_PT">External ftp url for expense reports</name>
          <name locale="es_ES">External ftp url for expense reports</name>
        </nameTranslation>
        <assignTo>
          <assign type="${CLASS_TimedConfiguration}" />
        </assignTo>
      </dataFieldDescriptor>
            <findUnit>
        <fdfs>
      <FDF code="expense.reports.ftp.url">
        <item value="sftp://xxxxxxx@sftp-dmz.secure.ifao.net/ama-es-seat/exports" />
          </FDF>
        </fdfs>
      </findUnit>{code}
2. Change destination folder
>Attchment
"sftp-dmz.secure.ifao.net/ama-es-seat/{color:#de350b}*attachments*{color}" to "sftp-dmz.secure.ifao.net/ama-es-seat/{color:#de350b}*exports*{color}"
>Report
"sftp-dmz.secure.ifao.net/ama-es-seat/{color:#de350b}*reports*{color}" to "sftp-dmz.secure.ifao.net/ama-es-seat/{color:#de350b}*exports*{color}"

Best regards,
Yutaka

column1: Groupe Red Electrica - Incorect tax rate and updat tax rate key
column26:
Hello team,

1) Incorect rax rate
Customers report that they have select for 18% tax but are calculated at 10%.

Receipt with 18%
!image-2022-10-14-14-44-32-880.png|width=517,height=265!



In the Export XML is shown as 10% with TaxKey C1 (this one is for 18%)
!image-2022-10-14-14-44-46-976.png|width=467,height=238!

I think the value in folder "tax_rate.txt" is incorrect.
regular > 0.10
reduced >0.18

!image-2022-10-14-14-46-18-896.png|width=438,height=114!

vegas config
!image-2022-10-14-14-46-51-148.png|width=464,height=289!

src:
!image-2022-10-14-14-48-30-295.png|width=727,height=133!


2) Update tax rate key
0% => C0
10% => C2
18% => C1


{code:java}
            final MutableCostType notaxratekey = new MutableCostType(TypeOfTaxRate.NO_TAX_RATE_KEY, null, null, null, null, "C0", "C0");
            final MutableCostType reducedTaxRate = new MutableCostType(TypeOfTaxRate.REDUCED_TAX_RATE_KEY, null, null, null, null, "C1", "C1");
            final MutableCostType normalTaxRate = new MutableCostType(TypeOfTaxRate.STANDARD_TAX_RATE_KEY, null, null, null, null, "C2", "C2" ); {code}

Best regards,
Yutaka

column1: EGIS - Meal allowed
column26:
Dear Team,

This CI is following  the CI-7228

Egis would like that theri is no combination of IBST+ BT31, BT32, BT34 and BT50 for the same lunch or dinner.

On the other hand, it is ok to cumulate 2 different meals in the same day, i.e. 1 IBST for lunch and 1 BT31, BT32, BT34 and BT50 for dinner (or inversely).

Please could you set up this behaviour?

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
column291:
16/Sep/22 3:07 PM;mkuchciak;note:
 * IBST:
 ** BT40 - Indem. Business Short Term (IBST) LUNCH
 ** BT40 - Indem. Business Short Term (IBST) DINNER
 * BT31 - Lunch (France)
 * BT32 - Dinner (France)
 * BT34 - Meal (Out of France)
 * BT50 - Invitation;;;

column1: ÖBB: Paid by Company for Flight only present in Betriebsvereinbarung
column26:
*Current Situation*

Users that are assigned to a Collective Agreement that is different from 'Betriebsvereinbarung' get the paid by company Flight receipts accounted to 864I

 

*Future Situation*

Users that are assigned to a Collective Agreement that is different from 'Betriebsvereinbarung' get the paid by company Flight receipts accounted to the correct account to 964Z

 

 

*Root Cause*

This is missing in the other configuration files. It was only set for 'Betriebsvereinbarung'

https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/oebb/at/bv_oebb/20180101-99990101/customlogic.properties.xml#916

column298:
14/Dec/22 12:29 PM;nsanchez;[~ebert]  client is asking the following in regards to CI:

Since we have been informed that it is not possible to correct the errors (after importing the CIs) by reversing and recalculating, we deduct the incorrectly paid amounts from the employees by entering the corresponding wage types directly in SAP. 
If an employee cancels and recalculates one of these trips, it must therefore be ensured that the wage types are not automatically corrected and the amounts are deducted from the employee again. Please confirm.

If it is possible to correct at least some of the trips by cancellation and recalculation, please provide exact information for which trips this is possible.

 

thank you

---

Da wir informiert wurden, dass es nicht möglich ist, die Fehler (nach Einspielen der CIs) durch Storno und Neuberechnung zu korrigieren, ziehen wir den Mitarbeitern die fehlerhaft ausbezahlten Beträge ab, indem wir direkt in SAP die entsprechenden Lohnarten erfassen. 
Bei einem Storno und Neuberechnung einer dieser Reisen durch einen Mitarbeiter muss daher sichergestellt sein, dass nicht doch automatisch die Lohnarten korrigiert werden, und dem Mitarbeiter die Beträge dadurch noch einmal abgezogen werden. Bitte um Bestätigung.

Sollte es doch möglich sein, durch Storno und Neuberechnung zumindest für einen Teil der Reisen eine Korrektur vorzunehmen, so bitte um genaue Information, für welche Reisen dies möglich ist.;;;

column301:
29/Jan/23 2:55 PM;ebert;[~marscholl] I think ÖBB misundestood a few things. Some of the Statements can be correct, other Statements cannot be corrected. See attached the information for the Statements that could be correct with a re-calculate. For the Statements marked in red, the fix is not yet on production. But checking the Statements I added a comment - if or if not - the impacted Statements contain the links we need for re-calculation [^StatementsChecked.xlsx] 

All of the Statements are already Accounted (otherwise ÖBB could not see the discrepancies in SAP), so for the Traveler it is not possible to cancel the Expense Statement. This is only possible when an Accountant rejects the Expense Statements and an Expense Auditor also rejects the Statement. Hence, as long as the customer does not touch the Statements anymore in roles Expense Accountant and Expense Auditor, there is no risk for double reimbursement. 

But in general a double reimbursement should not be possible as ÖBB implemented the export with versioning, meaning when a Statement is send for Accounting a second or third time, they will use the difference only. 

 

[~buerger] ;;;

column1: enbw:no transmission to conovum/ITE-1111
column26:
+*Issue as reported:*+

Wage posting records were not properly generated for Employees after 2001 at EnBW (default config)

+*Labels:*+

SAExp:bd - very little details and the examples given by the customer in the original case are missing.

+*Root Cause:*+

Longer description for Codebusters:

+Observed behavior:+

The customer complains that the Posting records for "LOMA" (Generated in a custom script) are not being present in Expense Statements since roughly the change of the year (2021->2022). We have examples from past year where the PR were still generated. This year they are no longer being generated. (At that time the company rules were introduced for EnBW)

The customer is using the default configuration of EnBW:

/engine-configs/CalculationConfiguration/enbw/de/default/20170101-99990101/customlogic.properties.xml

+Business case:+

The customer wants to have 2 PR that show the Wage relevant parts of Subsistence per-diem - meal deduction. Divided into fixed and relative meal deductions.

The script sums the tax relevant parts of the subsistence and adds the tax relevant parts of the meal deductions.

This summing seems to no longer work as can bee seen by the debug messages.

+Example:+

Please find the request of the following example attached.

2 day trip with statutory per-diems and lowered deductions (15% 30% 30%)

So for the lowered deductions we have a taxable amount.

The system puts  0  and 8,4 EUR as output. Expected would be 0 and -2,8

+Expected behavior:+

The subsistence is statutory, hence no taxable amount is expected 

Script fetches 0 EUR for MealFixedDeductionStatutoryNetDeduction (seen in debug message)

Then the system checks if result is <=0 or >0 (to separate fixed and relative meal deductions - fixed deductions are set to 0)

Then the system adds the actual meal deduction - the statutory meal deduction (should be -2,8 for Absence 1)

in the second loop for Absence 2 the system should fetch the taxable subsistence from absence 2 and add it (0) - so expected is for the second output -2,8 (is 8,4)

Then the system should add again meal deductions - statutory for absence 2 (Breakfast+lunch -> 12,60 - 14) so the expected result for absence 2 is -1,4 

The expected final sum is -4,2 in this example

 

+Root cause:+

As far as I can see the wrong link is used when calculating the statutory meal deductions (The fixed are loaded. In the calculation the relative deductions are required.

+*Solution:*+

Please file a CI ticket and ask the Codebusters to correct the script by loading the correct link when calculating <taxable subsistence> + ( <Actual meal deductions> - {color:#de350b}<Statutory meal deductions>){color}

The red part is the amount where in my opinion the wrong link is loaded.

+*Follow up:*+

Please create CI ticket

If the colleague from Codebusters would like to have a brief call to explain the analysis above - no shame it's a bit complex :) ) - please set up a meeting.

I also talked with [~hilbich] - he will probably put a standard calculator into the backlog that solves the issue (Taxation of Subsistence + Meal split by Fixed and Relative deductions)

column1: Endress Hauser -Incorrect calculation and PDF report and warning message
column26:
Hello team,

Could you please adjust the PDF report and warning message.

1. Warning message
Receipt type „ Car washing ” in our locaions Endress+Hauser Italia S.p.a & Endress+Hauser Sicestherm S.r.L. there is a maximum amount of 15€. If the amount is higher there should be a warning message. The message was there before but since a unknown time it isn’t there anymore. (affected location: Endress+Hauser Italia S.p.a & Endress+Hauser Sicestherm S.r.L.)
!image-2022-07-13-15-50-02-234.png|width=636,height=278!
2. Receipts  > limit amount on PDF
If a amount of a receipt type is higher than the limit it should be listed in the section “Receipts out of policy” of the expense statement reports pdf.

Limit: car washing 15EUR
Brakfast: 3.5EUR
Lunch: 18EUR
Dinner: 33EUR
!image-2022-07-13-15-51-34-528.png|width=538,height=617!
 
3. Receipts out of policy
If the amount of the receipt type “Car washing” is higher than 15€ it should be listed in the section “Receipts out of policy” of the expense statement reports (pdf) as same as the other receipt types with an higher amount than the limit. It is not listed there.

!image-2022-07-13-15-54-02-770.png|width=432,height=555!

4. Reimbursement amount
If the statement includes receipt types that are paid by the employee and need to be reimbursed and also have a higher amount than the limit the calculation in the statement is correctly but in the pdf report of the expense statement it is wrong.
!image-2022-07-13-15-55-27-727.png!
 !image-2022-07-13-15-55-33-342.png!

5. incorrect calucurate on "paid by company"
If the statement includes the receipt type “Car washing” " Break fast" "lunch" and "Dinner" and the amount of this receipt type is higher than it is paid by the company the calculation in the expense statement is wrong.
!image-2022-07-13-16-00-36-477.png|width=1184,height=279!
!image-2022-07-13-16-00-57-095.png|width=861,height=314!

Best regards,
Yutaka

column294:
03/Aug/22 9:07 AM;nsanchez;client response:

Answer / Regarding Annex "TEST number of hours (Italy)":

According to the collective agreement, the number of hours is calculated according to the calendar day and not according to the 24-hour rule. Calculating from 17:30-17:30 is therefore not correct. The tax side (EStG) follows this approach.

If the system shows 24 hours by default (start to following day), then this hourly figure is not meaningful in the control and should be ignored.

Moreover, the 24 hours are on the first day (Austria), where they have not yet been reached. The second hour is for Italy. This is misleading, as one could think that it is the number of hours of the stay in the respective countries.

 ;;;
column295:
03/Aug/22 11:58 AM;ebert;[~nsanchez]
This ping-pong with ÖBB needs to stop. Their answer is simply wrong. In the mentioned case they attached a PDF with Betriebsvereinbarung. And this is calculating as per request of ÖBB in 24h. It was even requested this way by them. There are hundreds of test cases we made for ÖBB and all were approved by them

Screenshot of their own BV
!image-2022-08-03-11-58-23-278.png|thumbnail! 

second, where we put the hour information is our decision, not theirs. The hours are usually in the first line of each 24h block. For this display we don't care at all about the real hours traveled in this country. This is what we use the per diem calculation for. Why this is now such a big deal, I don't get. We do it the same way for all Collective Agreements

Please schedule a call with the customer

[~buerger] for info. need of arbitration of other tasks
[~marscholl] for info;;;

column301:
27/Jul/22 9:57 AM;djagodzki;h1. *Ticket's summary*
h2. The problem

Reported issue was connected to export.

The customer requested correction of missing g/l account and incorrect tax keys in export file.
h2. Cause

Incorrect engine configuration. The customer has been migrated to EMS. After investigation there clearly were missing g/l for some receipts and incorrect Tax keys inside system-wide EMS block. This incorrect configuration was there even before migrating to EMS, but because of how file-based engine calculation works the correct values were taken from location configs, instead of system config and in result the exports had correct values. The exact cause of this issue was that while working on some TRATON ticket someone did not generate the new version of accountingconfiguration.xml with new tax keys and new g/l accounts, therefore during migration the converter used those incorrect values from accountingconfiguration.xml.
h2. Solution

Manual change of incorrect values directly on EMS production system.
h2. Obstacles encountered

Not reproducible on BALI test server.

Making changes on TRATON production server requires PKI card, which significantly increases time required to complete a ticket and adds additional person to the process if developer doesn't have the card.
h2. For the Future

Make sure to include all locations / system configurations while running java helper class with new entries.

Have the same updated configuration for BALI and PROD.

Location names on BALI and on PROD should be identical. If there is name change requested make sure to also change it in TMS on BALI.

It'd be great if access to TRATON and all other vw systems were somehow easier for developers.

 

 ;;;

Cepsa did not have any custom export file, they used a standard one. Based on this fact I suspect the issue is caused by product regression.

 

 *Solution applied:*

!image-2022-06-22-11-03-26-860.png!

column1: Numiga OGE - "systemsettings.properties" needs to be add
column26:
Dear Team,

 

This CI is related ITE-924

Please could you configure the system in a manner that the configuration also works with statements that span over multiple configuration periods ?

The file "systemsettings.properties" needs to be add to the system folder of the engine configuration.

 

!image-2022-06-07-14-43-10-589.png!

{color:#172b4d}Feature is documented here: {color}[https://confluence.secure.ifao.net/display/EXPDLY/Calculation+of+statements+that+cover+multiple+configurations+time+wise]

 

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: Continental -  Adjuste "warning" message
column26:
Hello team,

Could you please adjust the "warning" message.

*{color:#ff0000}**********We can deployed directly to the PROD system************{color}*

I opened ITE-859 to warning messeage errors. The error message returns an error if it exceeds 1500 characters, so we need to omit the message to avoid getting an error.

Could you please adjust the "warning" message.

!image-2022-05-31-09-50-41-324.png|width=437,height=201!

<NOW>
 Please check receipt #2 and #3 as both identical receipt categories have the same date.
 Please check receipt #2 and #12 as both identical receipt categories have the same date.
 Please check receipt #3 and #12 as both identical receipt categories have the same date.
 Please check receipt #10 and #13 as both identical receipt categories have the same date.

<After>
 There are duplicate receipts with #2 and #3, #2 and #12, #3 and #12,  #10 and #13.

 

Best regards,
 Yutaka
column291:
03/Jun/22 4:19 PM;jtkacz;Hello [~yutaka],

I cannot adjust the warning message to version that you proposed, because every line of error (example: "Please check receipt #2 and #3 as both identical receipt categories have the same date.") is generated automatically for every pair of receipts with identical type and date. In this case the length of warning message depends on amount of receipts pairs with the same type and date. I can remove the beginning and the tail of the warning message in order to make it shorter (example: "Receipts #2 and #3 have identical category and date.").;;;

column1: Endress Hauser - Update customlogic
column26:
Hello team,

Customer repoted the not woking to customlogic on Italia location.

Could you please adjust the these logic.

{color:#ff0000}****** Please deploy to the test location first. After the customer checks it, it will be deployed to the production location.*****{color}

1.  Remove "Hotel" ReimbursementLimitValidator 
 <entry key="validation.Receipt.13">net.ifao.expense.validation.expense.all.customValidators.FixedReceiptReimbursementLimitValidator</entry>
 <entry key="validation.Receipt.13.receiptTypes">expense.basereceipt.receipt.hotel</entry>
 <entry key="validation.Receipt.13.limitAmount">100</entry>
 <entry key="validation.Receipt.13.countries">IT</entry>
 <entry key="validation.Receipt.13.countriesNotInList">false</entry>

2. Remove "Region" on mileage section.
!image-2022-05-30-11-47-53-473.png|width=465,height=131!

3.  Adjustment of the number of Person
  Even if the number of people is 2, Limit is calculated as 1 person. If there are multiple people, it must be calculated with the limit for that number of people.
 !image-2022-05-30-11-43-57-720.png|width=593,height=285!

Sample:
 number of Person 1: 44 EUR X 1 = EUR 44
 number of Person 2: 44 EUR X 2 = EUR 88
 number of Person 3: 44 EUR X 3 = EUR 132

Best regards,
 Yutaka

03/Jun/22 3:58 PM;gheorghe;Hi both [~yutaka] and [~mkuchciak]

As [~schmitt] contacted me I had a look on the case and regarding point 3 ), when I test in test location business entertainment is set up as a regular receipt type not as an entertainment type. At the time when the implementation took place the customer asked for limits for the following receipt types :CI-5218 

!image-2022-06-03-15-54-15-038.png!

and see below agreed to set up business entertainment as regular type of receipt

!image-2022-06-03-15-51-52-168.png|width=655,height=403!

 

I do not hold any other info after project was handed over to CUS

 

Anyways, if you now go test in test location which would be great to do it before asking any customer to test anything, you cannot of course have a limit per person if you have nowhere to mention an attendee

ES ID #9436286 

!image-2022-06-03-15-52-59-817.png|width=667,height=292!

 

!image-2022-06-03-15-53-48-946.png!

What is even stranger is that the business entertainment is set up as business entertainment type in Test location in vegas whereas is setup as regular in the prod one ( possible bug? this needs to be checked as seems to be an issue here)

 

PROD

!image-2022-06-03-15-56-49-763.png!

 

Test loc

!image-2022-06-03-15-57-24-515.png!

You need to tell the customer that they agreed to have a simple type of receipt before if they now want a limit per person this means that they back to business entertainment type and hence also need to deal with filling in occasion location mandatory fields which come with business entertainment type

Hope is clearer

Andreea

 ;;;

column1: Bentley - perdiem less than 5 hours wrong calculated - EMS
column26:
Dear Team,

Bentley complains because the per diem are not properly calculated.

 

Example #6754338, it should be calculated as shown below:

22 hours in the UK which returns £32

2 hours in Germany which returns £0 (as it's below 5 hrs)

 

But currently it's calculated like this:

22 hours in the UK returns £32

2 hours in Germany returns £10,43

 

In the [engine-configs|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse]{color:#172b4d}/{color}[CalculationConfiguration|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration]{color:#172b4d}/{color}[volkswagen-bentley|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/volkswagen-bentley]{color:#172b4d}/{color}[gb|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/volkswagen-bentley/gb]{color:#172b4d}/{color}[default|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/volkswagen-bentley/gb/default]{color:#172b4d}/{color}[20220301-99990101|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/volkswagen-bentley/gb/default/20220301-99990101]{color:#172b4d}/{color}{color:#172b4d}country_per_diems_fix_values.txt{color}, I see that there are 6 different prices

(per diem overnight ~ per diem absence > 15h ~ per diem absence > 10 h ~ per diem absence > 5h ~ per diem absence > 0h ~ currency)

But I don't see the "per diem >0h" which should in 0€ maybe because is not needed it to be informed.

!image-2022-05-27-10-20-56-627.png|width=717,height=254!

 

In engine-configs/CalculationConfiguration/volkswagen-bentley/gb/default/20220301-99990101/country_per_diems_factors.txt, in the lines "Defines the amount of hours", should it not notify?

!image-2022-05-27-10-21-14-126.png!

 

Please could you verify and fix this issue?

 

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: Porsche - Per diem not calculated properly after "No PerDiem days"
column26:
Dear Team,

 

Porsche complains that the Perdiem is not properly paid when there are private days (No per Diems) in the middle of the Business Trip.

I think that something change in the perdiem calculation because as you can see my test did in March 2022 (#6220217), the calculation has been done properly, user is entitled to the > 8 hours package of the destination country (here: IT / Milan) .

!image-2022-05-25-10-51-05-844.png|width=530,height=659!

But in my new test today (#6743611), the calculation is wrong.

!image-2022-05-25-10-51-28-134.png|width=493,height=601!

 

Please could you investigate and fix the issue?

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
column172: 04/Nov/22 - in progress, Matthias is working on it
column291:
20/Jun/22 2:40 PM;devries;Hello [~ssanz] ! The calculation behavior is correct so far. I discussed it with [~mueller], it is more a problem of understanding on Porsche's side.

If the traveler returns to DE in between on his business trip and then marks these days "with no per diem" and then starts again from DE, then our calculation is completely correct, since the trip then starts again in DE and not in Italy and therefore he also gets the per diems for DE and the meal cuts and not for Italy. That is perfectly correct by law. The calculation will work when the traveler has to end the first trip and then create a new statement for the next start.;;;
column292: 21/Jun/22 10:11 AM;ssanz;Thank you [~devries], I replied inn this way to Porsche. I will wait if they send a feedback or not to close this CI. Thank you. BR, Sandra;;;
column293:
22/Jun/22 8:28 AM;ssanz;Hi [~devries], Please see below the Porsche answer, they are not agree with my answer and want to escalate the case. Please could you have a look again ? Thanks for your help.

Best regards, Sandra

 

"Nein, das ist nach deutschem Steuerrecht nicht korrekt! Die Dienstreise wird am Montag wieder aufgenommen und der Reisende übernachtet am 1. Tag in Italien. Dann erhält er die Pauschale von Italien.

Alles Andere ist Unsinn, sonst würde JEDER Reisende am 1. Tag seiner Dienstreise die Pauschale von Deutschland erhalten und nicht die des Ziellandes.

Der Fehler ist somit nicht behoben. Leider sehe ich mich nun gezwungen, das Ticket auch intern zu eskalieren."

 ;;;
column294:
23/Jun/22 2:33 PM;devries;We will create a feature request to provide a Calculator for Porsche that include all requirements. To fix it per custom logic make no sense anymore, it would be too error prone. I will provide the status soon.

https://jira.ifao.net/browse/CE-3963 ;;;

column1: Vaillant - Adjust "expense warning"
column26:
Hello team,

Could you please Adjuste "expense warning" loginc.

We can deploy the adjustments directly to the production system without the need for testing.

I open the ITE-891, Martin mentioned that the The FDF "expense.warnings" sould not be sent from vegas to the Engine.
Could you please follow up this ticket

1) in vegas config do not use the "expense." prefix for this FDF as elementLinkRole (e.g. change "expense.warnings" to "warnings". Please note that the calculate does not receive this FDF any more but can still create and fill it.

 

!image-2022-05-23-16-45-49-380.png!

2) To ensure the FDF is then still sent back from Engine TO vegas add the elementLinkRole "warnings" to the "return link whitelist" (add file "returnlinkwhitelist" to the engine config and add "warnings") inside the engine customer configuration. 
This should prevent that the FDF warnings is sent to the EMS and prevent this error
OR 
You can limit the content of the FDF to 240 characters and cut it off if it exceeds it (probably not a preferred option ... )

If you are unsure of this adjustment, you can also contact Martin directly.

Thank you.
Best regards,
Sandra

column1: Allianz - KM displayed on the overview
column26:
Dear Team,

Allianz told us that since the last release, the kilometers billed are displayed on the overview line of the travel histories in the settlement.

But this Kilometers are shown with a dot instead a coma as used in Germany (e.g.: 27.234km instead 27,23km)

Is this possible to change and use the coma and if possible only add 2 digits after the coma?

FYI, in Germany the dot indicates the thousands.

Best regards,

Sandra

 

!image-2022-05-12-06-47-59-046.png|width=571,height=337!
column201:
Server: amadeus
System: ama-de-Allianz
Location: All DE
column292:
13/May/22 10:23 AM;salajan;Hello both,

Thanks [~mstaszek] .

[~ssanz] , feel free to open an ITE ticket since for me this looks like a bug: The decimal separator is in the user preferences. From your screenshots, it looks like this setting does not apply in all the places where the distance is displayed. The team can help you further with what looks like a bug in Vegas.

Here is the setting in the user profile:  !image-2022-05-13-10-23-45-466.png!

 

About the number of decimals, this is not configurable:
 * Users can input any number of decimals
 * The mileage map returns always 3 decimals. Users are then able to change (remove or add) them

Maybe in the ITE you canmention this and PDEF colleagues will decide if a setting is needed for this.

 ;;;
column293:
19/May/22 1:18 PM;ssanz;Hi [~mstaszek] , [~salajan] , thank you for you comments. I opened the ITE-881.

BR, Sandra;;;
column294: 01/Jun/22 3:13 PM;ssanz;this is a bug, there is the CE-3915 opened. I closed this CI. Thanks for your support. BR, Sandra;;;

column291:
10/May/22 10:39 AM;mrosiak;Hi [~yutaka]
The issue is connected with CI-5370. During posting record generation there is ongoing validation, which checks if receipts amounts of certain type ("expense.basereceipt.receipt.entertainment.int.meals") from one day don't exceed daily limit. The question is what should be done with this? There should be returned some error message or we should let to calculate the ES?;;;
column293:
11/May/22 12:58 PM;mrosiak;[~yutaka]
Just to make sure the statement should be calculated even though it fails validation ? The validators logic:  sum of amounts for "Personal meals on trip" receipts from one day can’t exceed certain limit. In this case: on 2022-03-08 there is 4770.47 peso spent, while the limit is 3680. I can of course suspend the validation, but I think that is not the case. We could i.e. add more precise error message.;;;
column294:
18/May/22 3:52 AM;yutaka;From CI-10215884
I received feedback from a customer. Please adjust to display the correct error message;;;
column295:

*I received feedback from a customer. Please adjust to display the correct error message*;;;

column1: amadeus:fdf error
column291:
05/May/22 3:23 PM;devries;The custom logic seems to be correct, I debugged it and notice that the fdf 'city' at two receipts of seven doesn't pass the value. All receipts have a filled fdf 'city', but the custom logic gets Null. I created a new statement to check it on my own and notice, that the fdfs are doubled. I think that maybe a wrong or not visible FDF is referenced which have no value. I'll create an ITE ticket for it to let it examine. 

!image-2022-05-05-15-21-26-420.png!;;;
column292: 05/May/22 3:40 PM;nsanchez;awaiting ITE-830 reply;;;
column293:
06/May/22 12:26 PM;nsanchez;*Cause:*

The error is caused by *CE-3795* which will be fixed for *19.9.*

Due to this error the FDF on receipt level get duplicated on Save action.

In the JSON you can see that the FDF has multiple actual value entries:

!_SA_duplicated_actual_value.png|thumbnail!

!_SA_duplicated_actual_value_2.png|thumbnail!

!_SA_duplicated_actual_value_3.png|thumbnail!

This is not expected during calculate and only one of those values is sent to the engine (for the 2 receipts the empty entry...)

*Follow up:*

Fix of *CE-3795* will prevent the error in future, but will *not* fix this statement. Please locate and delete the receipts #2 and #3 and re-create them (please make sure to only save the receipt once, if you do this before 19.9 release)

*Customer info:*

Due to the bug *CE-3795* receipt FDF can be duplicated when you click on save. These receipts (#2 and #3) are broken and need to be re-created. Fix is in route to prevent error in future and is planned for release 19.9. 
Reply;;;

column1: Allianz - Error message is missed when attachement is missing on the receipt
column26:
Dear Team,

This CI is related several Cis (CI-6149, CI-6161,...).

This behaviour worked properly until a few days ago and now for the follows receipts it doesn't work again:
 * seminar hotel fee/Tagungspauschale
 * hotel breakfast/Hotelfrühstück
 * tourist tax /Kurtaxe

 

The behaviour is follows for all DE locations *except for* the ABV locations, ALL RECEIPTS must have an error message that appears when attached on receipt is missing.

 

DE: In einem Ihrer Belege fehlt der Belegnachweis.

EN: An attachment is missing in one of your receipts.

 

As you can see in my example #8761456, there is no error message as expected when there is no attachment for the receipts mentioned above.

I tested the other receipts and the error message appears.

 

Please could you verify and fix the issue?

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

column26:
h2. *User Story*
h4. As a

{color:#444444}user {color}

column1: rheinmetall - Adjusting "warnings" messages and setting maximum number
column26:
Hello team,



The statement will fail before the calculation due to the large number of characters written to the FDF "warnings".
!image-2022-04-19-21-42-47-725.png|width=517,height=211!

!image-2022-04-19-21-43-03-671.png|width=396,height=289!
I opened ITE-789 and received advice from the DEV team.

>Reduce the text written to the Free Data Field. Eg is the Attention has pbc etc … always needed or could it be phrased differently?
>Add a size check in the custom logic itself to cut of the string after roughly 1500 characters

Could you please adjusting "warnings" messages and setting maximum number.


1. Could you please adjust the logic of the "warnings" message.

[https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/rheinmetall/de/default/20191008-99990101/texts.properties]

!image-2022-04-19-21-46-40-286.png|width=934,height=199!
 
 <Now>
error.expense.validation.warnings.ini=WARNING!
 error.expense.validation.missing.receipt.warning.mid=Receipt \{0} that is "Paid by Company" has description "\{1}".
 
 <After>
-error.expense.validation.warnings.ini=WARNING!-  {color:#FF0000}<- remove{color}
 error.expense.validation.missing.receipt.warning.mid.en_GB=\{0} : \{1} / Paid by Company.
 error.expense.validation.missing.receipt.warning.mid.de_DE=\{0} : \{1} / von Firma bezahlt.

 

2. Could you please set the Set the maximum number of this FDF.

An error will occur if this field exceeds approximately 1500 characters. If the text is transcribed beyond 1400 characters, set it so that the characters and numbers after 1400 characters are cut off.
 
 Best regarda,
 Yutaka

column1: DAMM - set limit for workflow W2 don't take in account
column26:
Dear Team,

 

DAMM complains because today the statements for the users with approval workflow W2 need to be approver twice by approver and approver restricted even if the set limits have not been exceeded.

This workflow W2 depends on the limits stated in the tab "Limits Expense types" of the ERS. There is a FDF called "Convenios" that comes in the User Profile, and regarding this value (1X, 2X, 3A...) there would be several limits.

If ANY of the limit is exceeded, then the statement must go to the first and the second approver. If NON are exceeded, then the statement should only go to the first approver.

 

As you can see in my example ES#8559347 even if the limits have not been exceeded, the secon approver is requiered.

 

I guess it's an issue with the limitamount which must be in > (higher than) the set limits for each receipts (breakfast, lunch, ....)

I checked the custom calculation scripts -> calculation -> expense data, I saw the workflow W2 and the limits but I'm not sure it's the right way.

 

Please could you verify?

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
column291: 28/Apr/22 4:29 PM;ssanz;Hi [~dykiert], as discuss, I did test in production and everything works as expected now. I will inform customer. Thank you. BR, Sandra;;;

column1: Rheinmetall - approval skip needs to be corrected
column26:
With CI-5913 an approval skip was implemented.
Original with CI-5913 the expected approval logic was the following:
{quote}_If the Total amount of the statement differs more than 10% from the sum of the booking amounts:_
_If the Difference exceeds 2500 EUR - Approval restricted YES, Approval final YES_
_If the Difference less than 2500 EUR - Approval restricted YES, Approval final NO_
_If the Total amount of the statement differs less than 10% from the sum of the booking amounts:_
_If the Difference exceeds 2500 EUR - Approval restricted YES, Approval final YES_
_If the Difference less than 2500 EUR - Approval restricted NO, Approval final NO_

_Exception: Single day trips without perdiems - less than 100 EUR (No approval)_
{quote}
Customer is still expecting the same logic, but current situation is that the setup with comparing the reimbursement amount (excl. paid by company) with the booking amount to get the difference. /see analysis from Martin with ITE-766).

*Correct would be: comparing the total amount of the Statement (incl. paid by company) with the booking amount.* 

Please adjust the workflow

column1: Rheinmetall - validation for FDF Netzplan needs to be adapted
column26:
Problem: 

Validation of FDF Netzplan is blocking the statement, as sometimes it may happen that the number put into FDF Netzplan by the booking is not available in the related list within the TMS. Hence the user needs to add a matching number into FDF Netzplan 2 and needs to set the percentage for Netzplan to 0% and for Netzplan 2 to 100%. The validation of Netzplan is now running into an error and the statement cannot be calculated.

 

To solve this problem, following adaptions need to be done: 

Step 1)
IF "Netzplan 2" is filled AND set to 100% AND "Netzplan" is set to 0% accordingly,
THEN field "Netzplan" should not be validated any longer, so that it cannot run into a validation error for "Netzplan".

Step 2)
IF "Netzplan" is set to 0% AND "Netzplan 2" is filled AND percentage for "Netzplan 2" is set to 100%,
THEN no posting record should be written in the PDF report or export file.

 

If anything is unclear, please ask Nicole Graf or Filip Kazmierczak

[UPDATE, 27-07-2022]: After the consultancy with the Customer we managed to persuade the Customer the proposed solution is not the perfect one and is increasing complexity of the customlogic again. Instead Customer agreed on the easier and cleaner solution to the problem, completely maintained and achieved in VEGAS (ce-configs) which is change of FDF "OriginalNetzplan" from "FREE_TEXT" to a "LARGE_LIST", please see the screenshot:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
With this solution cytric Vegas automatically checks if the value chosen in the booking flow is still available in the TMS (csv file uploaded on daily basis by the Customer). If the value is not valid anymore the field stays empty and the backend validation (customlogic in engine) won't be triggered.

column1: Rehau - Adjust export IDOC_PAY file
column26:
Hello team,

*{color:#de350b}*****{color}* *to be configured first in staging and ONLY after approval from client in prd*{color:#de350b}********{color}



We created CI-6255 and deployed to allow negative reimbursement of export. But unfortunately, we noticed an error, also in staging, that the export file for IDOC_PAY is not correct in case of negative reimbursements (overpayments).

Customer have tested in staging with export 56974 and statement 248574.

There are two segments <E1BPACCR04 SEGMENT = "10"> and <E1BPACGL06 SEGMENT = "4"> in the export file, which should not be present. They are not needed, instead they mix up the total posting. In fact, a similar issue was occuring when first implementing this export format.
Additionally, the tax items used for posting of the tax are wrong in case of negative receipts. See <E1BPACCR04 SEGMENT = "15"> below.

1) There are two segments {color:#de350b}*<E1BPACCR04 SEGMENT = "10">*{color} and {color:#de350b}*<E1BPACGL06 SEGMENT = "4">* {color}in the export file, which should not be present.
!image-2022-03-01-16-35-49-421.png|width=339,height=151!
!image-2022-03-01-16-36-29-091.png|width=391,height=178!



2) <E1BPACCR04 SEGMENT="11">
As stated above, this should be the amount segment for the first posting line. 
This means also, that the whole line item 2, should not be there. 
 
{color:#de350b}*correct: <ITEMNO_ACC>1</ITEMNO_ACC>*{color}
!image-2022-03-01-16-40-13-973.png|width=384,height=308!



5) <E1BPACCR04 SEGMENT="15">
This is the tax posting. It is related to all receipts with tax code VF in this case
Here VF stand for 19% VAT

<AMT_DOCCUR>19.00</AMT_DOCCUR>
This should be the total tax amount for all receipts with the tax indicator VF
Since there is only receipt, it should be the negative tax amount of this item. Here 19 EUR
{color:#de350b}*correct: <AMT_DOCCUR>-19.00</AMT_DOCCUR>*{color}

<AMT_BASE>100.00</AMT_BASE>
This should be the total net amount for all receipts with the tax indicator VF
Since there is only receipt, it should be the negative net amount of this item. Here 100 EUR
Together they make the total (gross) receipt amount for all receipt with the same tax code: here VF - 19%
{color:#de350b}*correct : <AMT_BASE>-100.00</AMT_BASE>*{color}

!image-2022-03-01-16-40-38-828.png|width=460,height=229!

Best regards,
Yutaka

column1: Allianz - Field "Reason for the correction of kilometers"
column26:
Dear Team,

Allianz complained because since the last release the auditor cannot read properly the field "Reason for the correction of kilometers" even if he passed mouse in Itinerary in the mileage allowance side.

I opened the ITE-652 and martin propose to create a FDF type like text area which might be an alternative and to try to define a text area with row size = 1 (here an example with 4 rows).

  !image-2022-02-17-15-33-22-912.png|width=534,height=270!

 

Below an example configuration:

 

<dataFieldDescriptor code="fdfwarnings" type="Text" elementLinkType="net.ifao.vegas.domain.expense.StringLink" elementLinkRole="expense.warnings">
         <assignTo>
           <assign type="${CLASS_ExpenseStatement}" displayOrder="13">
             <gui>
               <dataFieldGUI labelPosition="LEFT" rows="4" guiType="TEXT_AREA" />
             </gui>
           </assign>
         </assignTo>
         <nameTranslation>
           <name locale="en_US">Reason for trip</name>
           <name locale="de_DE">Reisegrund</name>
         </nameTranslation>
         <descriptionTranslation>
           <name locale="en_US">Reason for trip</name>
           <name locale="de_DE">Reisegrund</name>
         </descriptionTranslation>
         <roles>
           <canEdit name="ExpenseStatementOwner" />
           <canEdit name="ExpenseArranger" />
           <canSee name="ExpenseApproverRestricted" />
           <canSee name="ExpenseApproverFinal" />
           <canEdit name="ExpenseAuditor" />
           <canSee name="ExpenseAccountant" />
           <canSee name="ExportProcess" />
           <canSee name="ExpenseManager" />
           <canSee name="ExpenseAdministrator" />
         </roles>
       </dataFieldDescriptor>

 

Please create this before in{color:#FF0000} Bali{color} to test.

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: Allianz - ABV AD location // income tax for breakfast
column26:
Dear Team,

This CI is related to ITE-605.

 

Allianz told us that for all ABV AD locations breakfast should not have been deducted but only indicated as relevant for income tax (e.g.: ES 7600604).

Like this engine will calculate the taxable amount because statutory still includes the amounts.

 

Please could you make this change?

column1: Aquila: wrong export transfer  data
column26:
Cytric Expense pushes Files (pdfs, jpegs) to our FTP Server. In the filenames is always a relation between the file, the Cytric case and a csv-File with included Metadata. On our side we have to rely on the Metadata information to forward the data in the workflow.

 

{color:#FF0000}client has experienced rare cases, where file names and the text in the Metadata file is not matching and that is a hurdle in automation.{color}

{color:#FF0000} {color}

In the described case(screenshots and attached) there where file exports with the filenames 10629-*5930312-00-01-00-2022_01_20*T13_04_07-image.jpg for example.

In the responding csv-file this file is not addressed. In the column “Belegfeld1” is the text *5930312-00-08-00-2022_01_20* and others - but there is no filename related to that text (and there MUST be a file having that text as a part of the filename for each entry in the csv-File at least!).

In the CSV file, the part of the file name that represents the reference between an individual entry and a photographed or scanned booking document should appear in a column ("Document field1"). This information is essential for further processing for the booking system on the part of the customer.

If more clarifications are needed I need to arrange a call with the client so pls let me know

process:

 

!image-2022-02-02-13-02-06-294.png!

column293:
10/Feb/22 3:36 PM;mrosiak;Generally it works like this: depending on how long the trip is different postingRecords for perDiems are created:

* trip length < 15 days - Verpflegungspauschale / 47420200
* 15 days <= trip length <= 90 days -  Verpflegungspauschale / 6550 - but for each day separately
* 90 days < trip length  - Reisekosten ST/SV / 4020 - also for each day separately

And MJ23 is created for M wage posting records with an amount of zero for meal deductions. Numbers 4010, 4030, 4040, MJ24 aren't used anywhere in configuration.

;;;

column1: AM - Per diem logic correction
column26:
The current logic for AM concerning per diems is not working as per the customer's request

Currently the issue in the system is that we do not have any meals value added to the total per diem nor deducted from the total per diem and this is what needs to be corrected for all groups

This concerns the 1,2,3,4 groups of employees for one day trip and multiple day trips travels for NATIONAL travel type only ( international and local should remain untouched)

In case of NATIONAL travel type meaning only travel to Spain, the logic has to be as following:
  
 Amounts per group ( for domestic only, not international)
|| ||Group 1||Group 2||Group 3||Group 4||
|Out of pocket value (domestic)|24|21.60|19.20|16.80|
|Meal value|-|15|13.80|12.60|

Use cases:
 - One day trips & Multiple day trips
 - Based on time conditions: 14h & 23h

So for one day trips we have the possible cases:
     Before 14 Before 23 
     Before 14 After 23
     After 14 After 23
     After 14 Before 23

And for Multiple day trips:

DD : Departure day

-> DD Before 14h / DD After 14h

AD: Arrival day

-> AD before 14h / AD After 23h / AD Between 14h and 23h

FD (full day)

 

Amounts given as per calculation scheme:

M: meal

OFP: out of pocket

Daily per diem = OFP + M 

 
 *A/ One day trips -*  

a) All groups

After 14 before 23: 0

b) Groups 2,3,4 apply the following rules 
 Before 14 after 23: 1 OFP + 2M
 Rest: 0.5 OFP + 1M

c) Groups 1 applies the following rules 
 Before 14 after 23: 1 OFP 
 Rest:  0.5 OFP

(means that if the user click for meal deductions the amount should not change and remain the out of pocket one as per scheme)

 
  
 *B/ Multiple day trips*  -

Groups 2,3,4: 
|Time|Calculation method|
|DD before 14|1 OFP+2M|
|FD|1 OFP+2M|
|AD after 23|1 OFP+2M|
|DD after 14|0.5 OFP+1M|
|AD between 14 and 23|1 OFP + 1M|
|AD before 14|0.5 OFP|

 

  Gr 1:
|Time|Calculation method|
|DD before 14|1 OFP|
|FD   |1 OFP|
|AD after 23|1 OFP|
|DD after 14|0.5 OFP|
|AD between 14 and 23|1 OFP |
|AD before 14|0.5 OFP|

 

*C/ Meal deductions -* 

 

They should apply.

Ticking-unticking the meals in UI should behave on meals deductions as it´s indicated in the excel file attached. 

The deductions calculations should appear in the PDF ( they are currently with 0 as they are not correctly calculated)

Meal deductions are applicable ( in the system there are 2 meal types) hence whenever in the scheme only 1 meal value is added then if meals are deducted, the result amount should be the out of pocket amount regardless if there are 1 OR 2 meal deductions. If no meal in the scheme, if the user clicks on meal deductions, 1 or 2 meals, then nothing happens, the out of pocket amount is unaltered.

e.g.  1 OFP + 1 M

Deduct 1M => 1 OFP

Deduct 2M => 1 OFP

 *Acceptance criteria*

In order to validate the change, please check those scenario as unit test and create corresponding test script:

ES IDs example and expectations 

1. ES ID 7537643 - Prod AMADEMEA

Gr 3 Multi day trip _(MD)_ 

Below you can see what happen today and in red what is expected after the correction:

!image-2022-01-26-11-35-05-716.png|width=631,height=272!

 Explanation:

  - DD Before 2: {color:#4c9aff}2M + 1OFP{color} => 2x 13.80 + 19.20=27.6+19.2=46.8 

  - Full day:  {color:#4c9aff}2M + 1OFP  {color}=46.8 

  - AD Between 2 and 11 : 1M + 1OFP  => 13.8+19.2= 33 (this is already OK on Arcelor system)

 

Example 2 - with meal deductions (ES ID 7542739)

GR 4: 

OFP:16.80

M:12.60

 

  !image-2022-01-28-16-36-38-290.png|width=570,height=186!

For your information, generally, if it would have been without deductions, the calculation applied, would be:

DD after 14: 0.5 OFP+1M => 16.8/2 + 12.6=8.4 =12.6= 21

FD : 1 OFP + 2M =>16.8+25.2= 42

AD after 23: 1 OFP + 2M => 42

However, what is expected in this use case is to have applied the meal deductions as shown in screenshot above hence expected result is:

DD after 14: 0.5 OFP =>16.8/2=8.4

FD: 1 OFP => 16.8

AD after 23: 1 OFP => 16.8 +12.6=29.4

Please see XLS attached for calculation exemplification and better understanding  and also correct amounts expected as each group has different amounts

Call me if not clear

Please follow up with Sandra and/or Andres for testing

 

cc:[~ssanz] [~arastrilla]

column1: allianz:error:no meals received
column26:
as a user

I need to present my statement with all the meals without errors even for the same day

details:
 * user:[nigel.leppitt@allianz.com|mailto:nigel.leppitt@allianz.com]
 * location:DE-Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty SE, Muenchen
 * id:{{7443525}}

error:

!image-2022-01-11-15-58-27-454.png!

!image-2022-01-11-15-58-47-316.png!

within the absence:

!image-2022-01-11-15-59-34-095.png!

!image-2022-01-11-15-59-53-213.png!

As you can see the user has 2 absences for the same day and it is compulsory to check all the meals in each absence otherwise you get error:

!image-2022-01-11-16-01-57-472.png!

but if you click: _no meal received_ you get the other error.

I think this should have been fixed with: CI-5607

 

+tests 7454387:+

if I enable  in the first day  calendar check box:

´´No subsistence per diem (e.g. business trips to and between business premises at a single location)´´ 

(because i dont want to indicate i have a meal so i dont get the error)

I get error:

!image-2022-01-11-16-05-02-977.png!

 

if I dont enable it I get error:

 

!image-2022-01-11-16-06-45-239.png!

log id {{7443525}}:

[https://es.secure.ifao.net/s/vegas/app/kibana#/discover?_g=()&_a=(columns:!(message),index:e72d0340-8ef5-11ea-ab48-7f15ada64d98,interval:auto,query:(language:lucene,query:'7443525'),sort:!(contextMap.Timestamp,desc))]

log my test id 7454387: 

[https://es.secure.ifao.net/s/vegas/app/kibana#/discover?_g=()&_a=(columns:!(message),index:e72d0340-8ef5-11ea-ab48-7f15ada64d98,interval:auto,query:(language:lucene,query:'7454387'),sort:!(contextMap.Timestamp,desc))]

 

 

+target:+

-client must be able to present ES with indicating all meals in each itinerary section
column291: 21/Jan/22 7:58 AM;dykiert;[~nsanchez] you can only add one type of meal per calender day. If you have two absences on same day, just untick one of the meals and you won't get any error.;;;
column292:
21/Jan/22 8:59 AM;nsanchez;[~dykiert] it is mandatory in this system to always select a meal

but on same day calendar if we do:

example:

11jan 9-14 no meal received // 11jan 14-18 breakfast yo get error:

!image-2022-01-21-08-31-27-661.png!

11jan 9-14 no meals ENABLED // 11jan 14-18 breakfast

we get error:  !image-2022-01-21-08-32-17-023.png!

 

so we dont have a way out!!

pls look at my test in prd: 
 * 7535180

!image-2022-01-21-08-59-19-096.png!

 ;;;
column293:
21/Jan/22 9:14 AM;dykiert;[~nsanchez],

 

this is correct, you don't have to select the second meal. Just leave meals section empty. The validator which looks if there are any meals per absence added is looking only day by day, means if you have added on 11th Nov then you don't have to add another one on 11th Nov.

 

BR

Dominik;;;

column1: Rehau - Adjust export up to negative reimbursement amounts
column26:
Hello team,

Customer reported the No export file for negative reimbursements.
 I opened the ITE-510.  Doreen mentioned that the the export is setup to write posting records when the reimbursement is larger 0. 
 so Could you please adjust the export logic.

!image-2022-01-11-22-50-25-537.png!

And Doreen mentioned that the other parts need to be adjusted

In addition, when the reimbursement part is adjusted, please also check that the information is posted properly for such cases
 The posting record generated for this scenario is

!image-2022-01-11-22-52-45-364.png|width=1018,height=413!

When the segment lines in the idoc are written it checks for "Erstattung" but Credit.
 in this case we would not properly write the information because we have "Erstattung" but Debit. This should be adjusted to deal with "Erstattung" for Credit and Debit

!image-2022-01-11-22-53-06-643.png|width=447,height=399!

Best regards,
 Yutaka

column1: OGE - ITE-515 - employee group containing "rv"
column26:
Following code was implemented in some systems (see list below) and due to changes caused by EXPENG-657 this code is now not working properly anymore:
{quote}<entry key="calculation.AbsenceList.2">net.ifao.expense.calculation.expense.all.companyRules.PerDiemStringLinkModifier</entry>
 <entry key="calculation.AbsenceList.2.linkRole">expense.employeeGroup</entry>
 <entry key="calculation.AbsenceList.2.regex">(?i)rv</entry>
 <entry key="calculation.AbsenceList.2.operation">MULTIPLY</entry>
 <entry key="calculation.AbsenceList.2.operands">0.5</entry>
{quote}

Customer OGE has problems with this code right now as they are using employee group (Mitarbeitergruppe) called "Eigener PKW Fah{color:#FF0000}rv{color}ertrag" which is containing a "rv"
Due to the changes done with EXPENG-657 this kind of employee group will now be identified as "(?i)rv" = true and is cutting off 50% of the per diems.

As explained in ITE-515 the code should be changed 
from old: >(?i)rv<
to new: >^(?i)rv$<

 

The code needs to be adapted in customlogic.properties of the following systems and configurations, starting with customer OGE:
 * CalculationConfiguration/*ama-bcd-oge-de*/de/dienstreise
 * CalculationConfiguration/*ama-bcd-oge-de*/de/meisterschulung
 * CalculationConfiguration/*ama-de-volkswagenblueprint*/de/dienstreise
 * CalculationConfiguration/*ama-par-numiga*/de/dienstreise
 * CalculationConfiguration/*numiga-master*/de/dienstreise
 * CalculationConfiguration/*numiga-master-test*/de/dienstreise
 * CalculationConfiguration/*ama-bcd-demo-numiga-de*/de/dienstreise

column1: Egis: wrong date and year in export file-ITE508
column26:
pls proceed as per ITE-508 instructions

+issue:+ 

he wrong month year(dec2022) is being sent on export file Erp

example id: 6520124

+[file:+|file://+/]

E;3331;3331;2022;12;NFA;3331;6520124;NDF;29/12/2022;29/12/2022;ROUSSELET 6520124 02/11/2021 05/11/2021;425200;3331;PER;0012098;EUR;;54,40;EUR;;54,40;EUR;;54,40;;;;;;;;;0012098;;NDF;VAE;O;29/12/2022;;{color:#ff0000}29/12/2022(should be 2021){color};;;;;;;;;;;17/12/2021;20/12/2021;;{color:#ff0000}29/12/2022{color};;;
 D;3331;3331;2022;12;NFA;3331;6520124;NDF;29/12/2022;29/12/2022;ROUSSELET 6520124 02/11/2021 05/11/2021;625122;3331;PER;0012098;EUR;54,40;;EUR;54,40;;EUR;54,40;;;;;;BANG19901-P03;BANG19901-P03;3331625122;3331625122;0012098;;;;;;;;BANG19901-P03;;;;;;;;;;17/12/2021;20/12/2021;;{color:#ff0000}29/12/2022{color};;;

 

+solution:+

The server time was correct.

The error lies within the Export code and must be corrected by a CI Ticket.

+*Detailed INTERNAL information:*+
 * The Java SimpleDateFormat that is used was given the parameter "formatString"
 * This string uses the captial Year "YYYY"
 * This means to use the Week Year option of Java (which is correctly 2022 in the last days of 2021)

 

 

Please see also:
 - [https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/12/docs/api/java.base/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html]

 - [https://newbedev.com/how-does-java-week-year-really-work]

 - [https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/RSPEC-3986]

for reference.

+*Solution:*+

Make sure to use only "yyyy" small year y's - which defines the actual calendar year - instead of capitay "Y" in all used instances of the call of the method getFormattedExportDate

column1: stroer:error:type of receipt missing
damm:wrong approval workflow

20/Dec/21 4:21 PM;nsanchez;note: please note in config there is also a limit by total reimbursement-> this should remain as it is

thank you;;;
column292:
21/Dec/21 9:23 AM;nsanchez;[~mkuchciak] we also need to add this implementation:

 

https://jira.ifao.net/browse/ITE-466

 

To avoid this problem for the future, it is advisable to add an additional Calculate step to the configuration. This was designed for Conditional Workflows in case there are a build on Calculation relevant values. 

The dataFieledDescriptor adds an additional Calculate step, before we check which approval flow the Statement should go. 

 
{code:java}
<dataFieldDescriptor code="preSubmitCalculateNecessary" type="Text" defaultValue="true">
 <assignTo>
  <assign type="${CLASS_TimedConfiguration}" />
 </assignTo>
 <nameTranslation>
  <name locale="en_US">preSubmitCalculateNecessary</name>
  <name locale="en_GB">preSubmitCalculateNecessary</name>
  <name locale="de_DE">preSubmitCalculateNecessary</name>
 </nameTranslation>
 <descriptionTranslation>
  <name locale="en_US">preSubmitCalculateNecessary</name>
  <name locale="en_GB">preSubmitCalculateNecessary</name>
  <name locale="de_DE">preSubmitCalculateNecessary</name>
 </descriptionTranslation>
</dataFieldDescriptor>{code};;;

column1: Allianz - Position "Werbungskosten"
column26:
Dear colleagues,

 

Allianz is reporting that the PDF Expense Report does show professional expenses of 0,07 EUR in statement 6403595 which they don't have any explanation for.

 

Customer does pay statutory mileage allowances of 0.3EUR/km. Therefore usually no professional expenses should occur.

 

Could you please have a look into this issue. Might be a rounding error in engine as there is a rounding custom logic applied to FDF "Distance" on itinerary level. 

 

I could find the following in our logs:

 

  !image-2021-11-24-17-20-12-783.png!

 

 

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

24/Nov/21 5:28 PM;mstaszek;From initial investigation is seems that this is probably cause by CalculationConfiguration/ama-de-allianz/de/default/20210812-99990101/5141334921/customlogic.properties.xml

!image-2021-11-24-17-27-57-578.png!;;;

column1: Burda - cytric TripID for cc feeds (CI-5908)
column26:
With CI-5908 the TripID was implemented as identification for cc feeds, but as it seems the old code was implemented and the imported cc feeds will not be reconciled with the tripID, yet.

Within [https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/ce-configs/browse/configurations/travel/Burda/configuration2021_01_01.xml?at=release/19.6 |https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/ce-configs/browse/configurations/travel/Burda/configuration2021_01_01.xml?at=release/19.6]the code that is defining {{tripIdEnrichmentCode="ACCOUNTINGUNIT" }}is missing, but this would be needed to let Expense know to which trip the cc feed is related to.

Please correct to the new cc feed code.

The identifier is: DTG0059

column1: Porsche - Per diem departure day don't calculated
column26:
Dear Team,

Please could you have a look in this behaviour concerning the per diem paid to the arrival and departure day after a long trip? 
Porsche ask to add the per diem for the arrival and departure day few weeks ago, please see CI-5752.
We asked to them to re calculate all statements done before the new setup but that seems don't work.
Here you have two example, one done where the amount of the departure day has been calculated properly even if user stayed less than 8 hours (#5352733) and the other one where the amount has not been calculated (#5027482) while both are similar travel.

Thank for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: rheinmetall -  Approval skipped on ES
column26:
Hello team,

Customer reported that the approval process was accidentally skipped.

Sample ES: 7086385
 This statement requires approval but accidentally skipped the approval process and proceeded to audit.
!image-2021-10-28-20-45-32-386.png!

I opened an ITE ticket (ITE-343) for investigation
 Martin found a wrong point for this issue.

The Approval logic is:

If the Total amount of the statement differs more than 10% from the sum of the booking amounts:
 If the Difference exceeds 2500 EUR - Approval restricted YES, Approval final YES
 If the Difference less than 2500 EUR - Approval restricted YES, Approval final NO
 If the Total amount of the statement differs less than 10% from the sum of the booking amounts:
 If the Difference exceeds 2500 EUR - Approval restricted YES, Approval final YES
 If the Difference less than 2500 EUR - Approval restricted NO, Approval final NO

Exception: Single day trips without perdiems - less than 100 EUR (No approval)

*The solution is also presented here. (ITE-343)*
 Martin thought is that the WF is claculating the per-diems wrong. And we could get rid of the whole logic if delivery activates CE-168 - then there is no bugfix needed, the whole "shadow calculate" logic can be removed - which will fix the bug and makes the WF much easier.

[https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/expense/browse/WfProcDefPlugin-WfProcessExpenseRHEINMETALLUPDATED.jar/src/main/java/net/ifao/vegas/workflow/process/expense/RHEINMETALLUPDATED]

!image-2021-10-28-20-33-07-358.png|width=1299,height=257!

these classes hold the old per-diems (cause the implementation was just intended as a "hack" to be in place until CE-168 is delivered - it should have been removed already 2 years ago )

Inside the isApprovalRequired Class this whole code is dedicated to shadow calculate the amounts:

!image-2021-10-28-20-34-22-426.png!!image-2021-10-28-20-33-37-391.png!

!image-2021-10-28-20-34-53-167.png!

this all can be removed - cause CE-168 ensures that all amounts are calculated by engine before entering this class
 So this is all that remains from the logic:
 !image-2021-10-28-20-35-35-842.png!

I don't understand everything about the engine config, so if you have any questions please contact Martin for a quick answer.

Best regards,
 Yutaka

column291:
29/Oct/21 10:10 AM;salajan;Hi [~guinoo]

!image-2021-10-29-10-09-12-262.png!

The tripLengthThreshold parameter of the FixedReceiptReimbursementLimitValidator works opposite to how you described it. As configured, your receipt will only be reimbursed if the itinerary is more than 14 days.

If you have an itinerary of 14 days and 1 minute, the laundry will be reimbursed (limited to 50 eur as per the other validator)

Now

!image-2021-10-29-10-10-29-356.png!

I understand that you want this limit lowered to 5 days? Is this the request? We can't do "nights" unfortunately.;;;
column292:
02/Nov/21 12:06 AM;guinoo;Hello [~salajan], thank you for the above information.
I have just clarified with logger and was advised that - cleaning costs should be reimbursed for every trips longer than 5 days and there shouldn't be any limit. Thank you!;;;

column1: Rheinmetall - change validity date based on ITE-326
column26: validity in cE-configs/configurations/mega/rheinmetall/RWM entities/RWM DE - Rheinmetall Project Solutions GmbH/configuration2018_01_01.xml must be increased (based on ITE-326)
column291:
28/Oct/21 3:48 PM;ngraf;It turned out that in DB there is one not deleted entry with validity date 01.01.2021 for config file configuration2018_01_01 and this is related to old export data (wrong path to ../RME/expense and SAP91 instead of SAP05)

solution step: creating a new config file with name configuration2021_01_01 and validity date 01.01.2021, so that the old entry in the DB that is related to all statements for Rheinmetall Project Solutions from 01.01.2021 until today will then be overwritten by the new file and new validity date;;;

column1: ÖBB - Type of receipt credit card fee not displayed
column26:
Dear Team,

 

ÖBB complained because since some times when users try to create a statement, the credit card fee charged for the departure from abroad to Austria is not displayed as a flight receipt as was previously the case and the statement cannot be calculated.

+Error message+: error.expense.200017 Voucher type missing

Statement example : # 6953224

Please could you fix this behaviour?

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

System: OEBB
Location: All

column293: 08/Nov/21 3:58 PM;ssanz;Hi [~dykiert], customer reply to that theTest 03.11.2021 successful and Credit card fee is displayed correctly again. BR, Sandra;;;

column1: Allianz ES - Export is exporting statements double
column26:
within cE-configs/configurations/amademea/ama-de-allianz/ES-Allianz Technology Sucursal en Espana/

the export part is implemented twice. This is causing that the export files do contain the statements twice.

Please remove the second part

importClass(net.ifao.vegas.domain.expense.ElementLink),importClass(java.text.SimpleDateFormat),importClass(java.text.DecimalFormat),importClass(java.text.DecimalFormatSymbols);var formatSymbols=new DecimalFormatSymbols;formatSymbols.setDecimalSeparator(".");var decimalFormatter=new DecimalFormat("0.00",formatSymbols),decimalFormatterExchangeRate=new DecimalFormat("0.00########",formatSymbols),dateFormat=new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd"),dateTimeFormat=new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss");function getExportRevision(e){var t=e.statementDocument.stateChanges,n=0...

 

it is slightly different to the first part and was forgotten to be removed, wehn the now fisrt part was added into the code.

column1: Rheinmetall - Hotel Breakfast receipt error message
column26:
Dear Team,

 

Rheinmetall complained because for some times now when an user tries to create a "Hotel Breakfast" receipt, he has an error message "Ungültiger Belegtyp" (invalid document type) and he is obliged to tick in the checkbox "Missing Receipt Declaration" while before it was not necessary.

 

Please could you verify and fix the behaviour ?

 

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
