14/Oct/21 8:07 AM;mstaszek;Hello [~ssanz] :)

Rheinmetall is quite complex system. They have AG, RME, RWM entities?
Can you also clarify if this issue occurs on every location, specific location or maybe you can narrow this down to specific entity?

Could you provide any example statement from customer?

Thank you!;;;
column292:
18/Oct/21 12:02 PM;klamann;Hi [~mstaszek]
I just had a call with Rheinmetall who informed me that it affects the location RPS and in particular just the user Mr Muehlbach (for example statement ID 6928441).
For his user all statements are affected. Maybe there is a problem with the user..?
Please find attached screenshots and further information from the customer.

Kind regards,
Claudia
;;;
column293:
20/Oct/21 4:47 PM;mstaszek;Hello [~klamann] and [~ssanz] :)

I think that this user created expense statement and after this switched location.
+Before+ his user was in some *RME* location and now he switched to *_Rheinmetall Project Solutions GmbH_* which is based on *RWM* config.
This is the reason why it doesn't work. those two configs are not compatible.
Receipts have other codes and calculation throws error.

*Solution is* to create expense statement from scratch or change back the location. 
Depending on what calculation result they expect.

Could you clarify with Rheinmetall if my suspicion is correct? 
If yes propose my solution.

Thank you!;;;
column294:
21/Oct/21 5:03 PM;ssanz;waiting for customer feedback

Thank you [~mstaszek] for this clarification, I let you know as soon as I have the information;;;
column296: 25/Oct/21 12:14 PM;ssanz;[~mstaszek], I have a doubt when I finished to write my message. Customer said to us that the user was originally in a RWM Location and now is in a RPS location but I re-verified and user is as you said so I guess customer made a mistake. I will verify with him and back to you asap. BR, Sandra;;;

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra;;;

column1: Bentley - Incorrect meal reduction on UK
column26:
Hello team,

Incorrect meal reduction on UK location.

The UK per diems deductions for Lunch and Dinner are incorrect. Currently the deductions in the system are set as £5 for lunch and £5 for dinner.

This SHOULD be £10 deduction for Lunch and £15 deduction for Dinner.

GB~UNITEDKINGDOM~25~25~25~10~10~GBP

column293:
22/Oct/21 4:46 AM;yutaka;[~mstaszek] [~ssanz] 
 Hello Both,
 When the configuration of "DoubleBudgeting_20210723.xml" was added in July, the tax configuration is also strange.
 The solution to this problem is to add tax to configuration of "businessTrip_20210723.xml."

Could you please update the all configuration for "businessTrip"

<now>
 <typeOfReceipt code="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.hotel.seminar.fee" defaultTaxRate="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regular">
 <taxRates>
 <taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.none" />
 <taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regular" />

column1: ÖBB - Request for adjustment of foreign rates
column26:
Dear Team,

 

Please here a ÖBB request :

 

KV Metallgewerbe Ang - Breakdown of daily allowances in Switzerland and abroad - One-day and multi-day business trips

 

ACTUAL: In the travel expense report for foreign countries, the allocation is made according to fee level 3.

SHOULD: The TG should at least be at the level of the rates provided for domestic business trips and then be divided accordingly into the domestic share and the foreign share, as well as LSt-free and obligatory. - as for metalworkers

 

Extract from KV Metallgewerbe Ang:

"For journeys outside Austria, daily and overnight allowances are due at least to the extent of the rates provided for domestic business trips, insofar as this results in a higher entitlement. The higher entitlement shall be determined by comparing the entitlement according to para. 4 lit a to g and the entitlement according to para. 5 c to e. see extract KV Metall Ang 2018 -and KV Metaller Ang_Reisekostensätze 2021

 

currently, only fee level 3 is charged for foreign diets.

 

User Stage Test: Friedrich Braun Clouduser 20063957 (1) - cytric Expense ld: 215188; created on 15.9.2021 , and cytric Expense ld: 218222 and cytric Expense ld: 220191 created on 15.9.2021

 

Please see attachment.

 

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: Vaillant - Wage type calculation Spain
column26:
Dear Team,

Vaillant asked to change for their Spanish Locations, the behaviour for the WT4601-Exempt National Per Diems with Overnight, according to them, the WT should be calculated per day and not for the whole stay.

 

+e.g.:+

Statement 4922457 which is currently in finished. In this statement we can see two receipt "Meals (travel related) - with overnight" one with the amount of 19,95€ and another one with the amount of 41,23€

Currently in the customer SAP the WT appears as follows, WT 4601 Exempt National Per Diems with Overnight 53,34€ and in WT4603 NOT Exempt National Per Diems with Overnight 7,84€.

We should only have WT 4601 total amount 61,18€ since it does not exceed the 106,68€ per the two days

If the amount would be over than 106,68€, in this case the difference should go in the WT4603

 

This behaviour must also be that of wage types from a cumulative WT-calculation:

 

4601 Exempt National Per Diems with Overnight
4602 Exempt International Per Diems with Overnight
4603 NOT Exempt National Per Diems with Overnight
4604 NOT Exempt International Per Diems with Overnight
4605 Exempt International Per Diems
4606 NOT Exempt National Per Diems
4607 NOT Exempt International Per Diems
4608 Exempt National Per Diems

  !image-2021-10-05-12-33-22-450.png!

 

Please change the behaviour.

 

Thank you,

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: Porsche - Wrong Per Diem calculation
column26:
Dear Team,

 

The DE market rule to calculate the per diem when a user report two different place in the same day, is calculated the per diem according to the location you reached last prior to midnight.

In this case Porsche reported to us that is not the case currently but as from what I have seen that's not all time.

Please refer to the attachment, only the change place the third day is not calculated as expected. The change place the fourth day to France to Switzerland as calculated properly.

 

Also note that meal deductions are calculated as expected the third day.

 

Test performed in staging (#226046)

 

Please investigate and change the behaviour if needed.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: porsche: correction in perdiem summer time
column26:
hi team

as per ITE-292 we need to correct as follows:

 

The issue is caused by the fact that "net.ifao.expense.calculation.expense.all.companyRules.FindPerDiem" does not support the changeover from winter to summer time (daylight saving) on 28.03.2021 which results in just 23h, because "companyRules.FindPerDiem" calculation is based on thresholds in terms of duration.

 

Example: [https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/porsche-test/de/businesstrip/20210501-20210715/5224357997/customlogic.properties.xml#530-532] 

Please note that the usage of company rules along with German market template is currently not supported.

Please check with <codebusters /> if the usage of "net.ifao.expense.calculation.expense.all.companyRules.FindPerDiem" can be circumvented (use DE market template defaults).

Please note that in PI#2 iteration 3 aims to make the DE market template compatible with company rules.

 

+*issue reported*+

on 28th march the perdiem is wrong:

example staging: 225072

!image-2021-09-30-15-54-34-019.png!
column291: 14/Oct/21 4:05 PM;lanfermann;To be done by engine team as discussed with [~ebert];;;
column292:
20/Oct/21 10:13 AM;lanfermann;[14.10 16:15] Marius HILBICHCompany rules only support hour thresholds, if we want to support intermediate days based on labels then this would be an enhancement request which should go through PM.
 ;;;

column1: porsche: correction in perdiem
column74: 29/Sep/21 1:03 PM;nsanchez;225031 Test Deutschland-Mahlzeiten bei normalen DR ohne 3-Monatsfrist (1).pdf;https://jira.ifao.net/secure/attachment/125671/225031+Test+Deutschland-Mahlzeiten+bei+normalen+DR+ohne+3-Monatsfrist+%281%29.pdf
column291:
29/Sep/21 1:06 PM;nsanchez;client aware this breaks statutory regulations:

_achbezugswerte_ are reductions for meals for which the traveler is on the journey for less than 8 hours and therefore has no legal entitlement to a meal allowance.

In this case, the statutory meal reduction of 20% / 40% / 40% for breakfast / lunch / dinner from the maximum daily sum does not apply, but the "Sachbezugswerte" are used

 ;;;

column294: 01/Oct/21 12:52 PM;nsanchez;we doubt it was like that but according to them it has always worked...;;;

column1: MAN-ES:CE-3527: mobile receipt error at calculate/configuration file
column26:
this case is urgent as it is pending since Aug and all entertainment receipts are pending

as per https://jira.ifao.net/browse/CE-3527
h2. +please fix issue:+

On UI side we have different ways of handling related Free data field depending if it is related to a receipt type BusinessEntertainment or not.

After discussion with implementation team and Florent (PO), the issue seems to come from the configuration file and can be fixed:
by removing <relatedDFD dfdCode="typeOfMeal" /> from the type of receipt "Present" as it is a BusinessEntertainment
and adding a business Entertainment dependency in the FreeDataField <dataFieldDescriptor code="typeOfMeal">.
So that it can be related properly to Business entertainment in our code

------------------------------------
h2. +issue reported on CE:+

 
UI version: 19.5.0

I have used EFBE platform to reproduce and describe it as currently Jakarta is down, but the behavior should be also visible on Jakarta, once it is up and running using the same system and login credentials. If a Mobile Receipt is missing there (search for the whole September 2021), please contact someone from Improvers (ex. EFBE) team members.

1. Go to Expense -> Your expenses
2. Select period 10.09.2021
2.1 (If needed) If there is no Mobile Receipt with id=154341 on the dashboard search for an ES created from it and if found delete it
3. Select the Mobile Receipt from step 2.1 and click Create ES -> Create
4.1 Open the response body of GET ExpenseStatement service
4.2 Look into services->[0]->receipts->[0]->namedValues list
4.3 Open the FDF with name "Type of Meal" (see l !loadES.png|thumbnail! )and you will see a generated FDF id returned from the service
5. Click on the Receipt to open it
6. Fill in the Entertainment mandatory fields: Occation, Location and Internal/External attendee
7. Choose DINNER from the "Type of Meal" FDF dropdown and click Confirm changes
8.1 Open the request payload of PUT Receipt service sent from UI
8.2 Look into namedValues list
8.3 Open the FDF with descriptor code "Type of Meal" (see !saveReceipt.png|thumbnail! ) and you will see the the UI does not send the FDF id mentioned in step 4.3

With the missing information mentioned in step 8.3 the behavior of the PUT Receipt service is that it creates a new FDF while there is already created one before, and this happens on every save and also breaks the FDF BE validation. I have added the generated FDF id from step 4.3 in the PUT Receipt service payload and executed the request with Postman and the response now was 200 OK and there was an actualValue id generated as a response added to that FDF. So I can assume that the problem can be fixed with a change in the UI and it is also the most proper place to fix this client issue as all the services working with FDFs are working this way with reusing already created IDs (FreeDataField, DataFieldValue) when update. This can be seen also in the Classic Expense UI.

column1: enbw - sum candidate manipulation no longer possible
column26:
A custom logic script is trying to access the sum candidates which have been removed in engine release 19.4.2

It seems like the script is trying to remove the statutory amounts depending on a FDF.
An alternative solution would be to add the following parameters to the StatutoryVehicleUsageCalculator:
 # executeLinkRole - temporary.vehicle.usage.tax.relevant
 # executeLinkValues - true

Or since this link is created in another script anyways, directly use the link role "expense.absence.supressStatutoryMileageAllowance" on the parent absence instead of the temporary link. This is a build in function to suppress statutory mileage calculation.

The following systems are affected:
 * enbw
 * enbw-staging-test
 * enbw-test
 * expensereader-mobile
column291:
11/Oct/21 5:24 PM;ngraf;It turned out that there is still an open point: the mileages will not be shown as tax income releavant.

With CI-2900 it was implemented, that if
 * egolf without comment
 OR
 * egolf with comment

is used, then this mileage is tax income relevant

 

Later this was adapted by CI-4029.

 

The relevant script is this one:  <entry key="postingRecordGeneration.ExpenseData.7.scriptContent">
 [https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/enbw-staging-test/de/default/20170101-99990101/customlogic.properties.xml?at=577ffa83bac6325b200113d29d0fc7d075eeb9f9#790];;;
column292:
12/Oct/21 4:52 PM;ngraf;realized during test on bali, that also the export needs to be checked



If income tax relevat milage, then posting record LOKM needs to be written. And as soon as LOKM is written, posting record KMPAU is not allowed to be written anymore

https://jira.ifao.net/browse/CI-3464
https://jira.ifao.net/browse/CI-3263;;;

column1: Allianz - Error message related to the checkbox "Working hours…"
column26:
Dear Team,

Allianz users are currently experiencing the error message "Bitte geben Sie den Grund für die Überschreitung der Arbeizeit nach ArbZG bzw. der nicht geplanten Kompensation derer im dafür vorgesehenen Feld an."

From what I could read in the "updated cytric Expense Implementation Guide - Allianz ABV" and if my translation is correct when  checkbox "Working hours…" is ticked, we have to put a comment in the free data field "Reason for exceeding working time".

!image-2021-09-10-11-44-14-602.png|width=709,height=154!

Statement in Prod: 5799059 (I was allowed to test it) - I added a comment in each itinerary but even the same error message.

Statement in staging : 221297 - When I ticked in the checkbox and I added a comment, I still have an error message and all itineraries are in red with the same error message.

!image-2021-09-10-11-46-16-952.png|width=649,height=131!

 

!image-2021-09-10-11-44-51-172.png|width=446,height=152!

On the other hand I noticed that the checkbox is not in the same place in staging or Production. In staging is in the header level and in Production is inside the itineraries.

Christian Caspar confirmed that the checkbox should be in header level.

So first of all, we need to see why in staging the error message occurs, correct and once it's done imported in production

In production before all change the checkbox in header level

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: Eberspächer - calculation for VAT deduction on fuel - France market
column26:
Dear Team,

 

After CI-5200 and ITE-248, please could you make the following change:

 All this changes have been clarify with customer by Martin.

 

Business case:
 * In France Gasoline and Diesel have 20% VAT
 * Only 80% of the tax amount is deductible
 * They expect only this 80% of 20% as tax amount in the posting record

Situation as-is:
 * Tax key reduced_4 was introduced for all receipts in FR
 * it has 16% VAT
 * This is incorrect because 16% VAT != 80% of 20% VAT 
 * Example Receipt 116 EUR - 16% Vat is 116 - 116/1,16 = 16 EUR ----- Receipt 116 EUR 20% VAT is (116 - 116/1,2) * 0,8 = 15,47 EUR

Intended Change:

The French locations must have 20% VAT on Gasoline and Diesel. The tax amount in the posting record must multiplied with 0,8. There are special tax keys for Gasoline and Diesel that differ from locations.

Target picture: The user can select VAT "20% deductible" for gasoline and diesel receipts (is default). The PDF shows 20% and the correct 20% tax amount. The Posting record shows 80% of this tax amount in the tax amount field. Tax keys are:
|Loc|Fuel|Diesel|
|SAS|V6|V6|
|SAS ELA|V2|U3|
|SAS STM|V2|U3|

Changes in Detail (proposal):

1) Locations SAS, SAS ELA, SAS STM - change label of redued4 tax rate to "20% deductible" (vegas)

2) Locations SAS, SAS ELA, SAS STM - change tax rate of reduced4 to 20% (engine)

3) Locations SAS, SAS ELA, SAS STM - the tax rate reduced4 shall only be selectable for the receipts Gasoline and Diesel - remove reduced4 from the other receipts (...eberspächer.diesel, ...eberspächer.fuel) (vegas)

4) Locations SAS, SAS ELA, SAS STM - In the posting record generator multiply tax amount of receipts with tax rate reduced4 with 0.8 (by custom logic - engine)

5) Locations SAS ELA, SAS STM (not SAS) - In the posting record generator change the tax rate key for DIESEL receipt from V2 to U3 (by custom logic - engine)

 

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: Allianz DE - meal validation and check box "No subsistence per diem"
column26:
h2. *User Story*
h4. As a

{color:#444444}user / arranger{color}
h4. I want to be able to
 * {color:#444444}calculate and submit statements that do include "no meal received" as the selected meal and I don't want to get an error that tells me that I must select a meal{color}
 * {color:#444444}to see the checkbox "No subsistence per diem" and I want to be able to activate this checkbox{color}

 
h2. *Acceptance Criteria*

With implementation of the double budgeting and business trip 
 * the checkbox "No subsistence per diem" is not available in the itinerary section anymore, as soon as the user has selected configuration "business trip" or "double budgeting". The checkbox is only available for config default which is for nearly all locations not selectable anymore
 --> the checkbox needs to be added to both new configs with identical behavior like in default config

 * the validation for meal selections needs to be identical like in default configuration.
 At the moment it is not possible to select only "no meal received". Because even if it is selected, the validation runs into error and advises the user that a meal must be selected

column1: porsche:wrong perdiem for non overnight stays
column26:
h2. *User Story*
h4. As a

{color:#444444}user {color}
h4. I want to be able to

{color:#444444}receive my allowance for days without overnight(daily interruptions for overnight){color}
h4. So that I

{color:#444444}my entitled allowances(14eur) even if daily interruptions for overnight are applied{color}
h2. *Acceptance Criteria*

{color:#444444}_example iD 5136546_{color}

log:Enterprise: Porsche / 6723340844 / 0 / DE / businesstrip / 20210715-99990101

2021081612561100001 !image-2021-08-23-14-50-49-303.png!

 

notes:

The traveler is only allowed to receive EUR 14 per day.
This is about 1 coherent business trip (factual context, as the reason for the trip is always the same) - with daily interruptions for overnight stays at home. This recording was standard in the previous system.
In this case, this approach enables the traveler to create only 1 instead of 8 expense reports.

 

I think it may be due to case: ref:https://jira.ifao.net/browse/CI-5321

 

thank you
column291:
24/Aug/21 9:01 AM;nsanchez;have attached client examples

 

thank you;;;
column292:
24/Aug/21 9:04 AM;nsanchez;client notes:

The itinerary shows a trip with an interruption, i.e. the business trip lasts a total of 2 weeks - the traveler is at home over the weekend and interrupts the business trip.
In the present case, the last travel day before the weekend is 07/23/2021. On this day, the business trip ends at 6:00 p.m. Therefore, he must receive a half-day flat rate of EUR 14.00 for this day (trip in DE).
The first travel day after the weekend is July 26th, 2021 - the journey will start again at 6:30 a.m. Therefore, he must also receive a half-day flat rate of EUR 14.00 for this day.

With best regards, Susanne Gomm;;;
column294:

hi Matthias, according to the client the configuration is as I attached the document, please have a look.

when the keine pauschale zahlen boxes are disable they DO GET 14eur

when they are enabled they DO not get the eur14

+client notes:+

How do you get private extension now? This is another checkbox that I didn't mention a word in the ticket. In the case of a PRIVATE extension, of course, NO meal allowance may be paid!
In the event of a break in the journey (all day), of course, NO food allowance may be paid.
Please imagine the following case: The traveler starts a 2-week business trip and interrupts this business trip in order to go home over the weekend and spend his LEISURE TIME there. At the weekend he should of course NOT receive any meal allowance, but the CORRECT meal allowance for ALL business travel days.
If he is still working on Friday and is only at home in the evening, he will receive a half-day flat rate for Friday. And if he starts work again on Monday, he will of course receive a half-day flat rate again.
If you look at my example, you'll find that 7/23 a Friday and the 26.07. is a monday.
At the same time, I informed Ms. Elzer. I hope you can explain your implementation and our concerns behind it better.
With best regards, Susanne Gomm

--------------

thank you

column292:
17/Aug/21 3:09 PM;devries;Hi Nuria, 
The reason is that the mileage per diems differ from statutory. For the double household they wanted to have the following rates (with https://jira.ifao.net/browse/CI-5196 7 weeks ago):
*motorcar: 30 Cent up to 20km and 35 Cent above 20km.* 
Statutory have always 30 Cent. The difference will be presented as Income tax relevant (10,44 EUR). 
So, it seems to be ok from our side!;;;

19/Aug/21 6:59 PM;devries;The problem is that with https://jira.ifao.net/browse/CI-5502 was moved the FDF "Working hours as per ArbZG are not exceeded or compensated" from absence level to statement level without validation date change. Exisiting statements still keep the FDF in the absence level and after calculation now the new config is loaded with the FDF on statement level. So the FDF on absence level is unknown and throws a NullPointerException. I created now the separate config with a starting date of the new config from the 12.8. All other old configs will load there exisiting config, so it should be no trouble anymore. 

The best solution would be to recreate the statement, so that a valid configuration is available now. Old statements which were submitted after the 12.8. have problems, too, because they the FDF now in statement level AND absence level, so that one of both is unvalid. These one must also be recreated.;;;

column1: TUI - configuration adjustments
column26:
For TUI AG, TUI Business Services and TUI Deutschland the following changes shall apply when the 3-month rule is active:

1. change of posting records (all three locations) (/)

*Currently:*

There are two postings on 6021 at the moment, one named 'steuerpflichtige Verpflegungspauschale' and  the other named 'Lohnversteuerung Verpflegungspauschalen'. 

*To Be:*

TUI just would like to keep 'Lohnversteuerung Verpflegungspauschalen' as a posting in the XML-Export. Please merge the two setups to one and put the logic behind ' Lohnversteuerung Verpflegungspauschalen'. Be aware: At the moment the logic behind 'steuerpflichtige Verpflegungspauschale' is the more complex one!

 

2. continued payment of normal meal deductions in 3-month-rule (test 5 in attached excel file)

*Currently:*

The meal deduction is calculated with the meal benefits in kind (1,83; 3,47; 3,47) and also shown like this on the pdf report including the professional expenses. (/)

*To Be:*

TUI AG: (/)

The normal meal deduction shall be deducted (5,60; 11,20; 11,20) like the 3-month-rule wouldn't be activated. Meaning, the 3-month-rule is active, but e.g. 5,60 are deducted for a breakfast. The meal deduction of 5,60... shall be shown in the deduction part on the pdf report. The taxable part (meal benefit in kind) shall only be calculated in the backend and shown on the pdf report in the income tax relevant part. (s. Darstellung TUI Kostenabrechnung - Future + Excel file)

 

TUI Business Services (Trainee) (/)

The reduced meal deduction shall be deducted (30% of the normal meal deduction – 1,68; 3,36; 3,36) like the 3-month-rule wouldn't be activated. Meaning, the 3-month-rule is active, but e.g. 1,68 are deducted for a breakfast. The meal deduction of 1,68... shall be shown in the deduction part on the pdf report. The taxable part (meal benefit in kind) shall only be calculated in the backend and shown on the pdf report in the income tax relevant part. (Excel file)

 

TUI Deutschland (Apprentice) (/)

The reduced meal deduction shall be deducted (2,00; 9,00; 9,00) like the 3-month-rule wouldn't be activated. Meaning, the 3-month-rule is active, but e.g. 2,00 are deducted for a breakfast. The meal deduction of 2,00... shall be shown in the deduction part on the pdf report. The taxable part (meal benefit in kind) shall only be calculated in the backend and shown on the pdf report in the income tax relevant part. (Excel file)

 

3. pdf report changes (all three location)

Within the pdf-report below each block (perdiems, deductions, total sum) additionally the professional expenses AND tax income relevant amount for this block is needed to be shown. (s. Darstellung TUI Kostenabrechnung - Future)

For TUI AG each block is already showing one of the two information, but not yet in the correct form.

Goal:
 * Each block should show the amount of the professional expense AND the tax income relevant amount. (/)
 * Each block need also to be shown if it is 0,00. (/)
 * There could be a situation where tax income relevant amount and professional expense are both available, then they are not allowed to be summed up and both amounts need to be listed for the block. (example for such a situation could be a trainee that has absences before start of 3-month-rule and additionally absences within 3-month-rule, both combined in one statement - for the absences that are outside of the 3-month-rule they will get professional expenses, but for the absences that are within the 3-month-rule they have tax income relevant perdiems) 

 

4. postings XML file

*Currently:*

When the 3-month-rule is active the meal benefits in kind are calculated for the meal deduction, but not deducted from the per diems part.

*To Be:*

Please check point 2 to see the new calculation logic for the meals during active 3-month-rule. As from this change onwards the meals shall be deducted from the per diems. (s. Excel file + s. Darstellung TUI Kostenabrechnung + configuration pdf for account numbers (page 26-28)) This needs to be changed in the calculation logic and the pdf report.

 

 5. account number *TUI Deutschland only (/)*

*Currently:*

The domestic per diems are posted on the wrong account.

*To Be:*

Please check the attached configuration file (page 26-28) to get the correct account number for this posting (741109).

 

6. M-flag missing *TUI Deutschland only (/)*

*Currently:*

M-Flag posting is missing in the XML file

 

*To Be:*

M-flag to be added into the postings on Wage 9325

 

 7. <Amount> vs. <NetAmount>

*Currently:*

The postings for account number 6021 have no taxes, but in some cases the Net amount is filled with content. Please check CI-4251.

 

*To Be:*

Please check the setup of the three location, that in case a posting on 6021 is done and the tax rate equals 0,then the Net Amount needs to be 0, too.

 

Please be aware of the implementation flow Bali-> UAT -> TUI

column1: Allianz - Add Skip Approval process
column26:
Hello team,

The CI-5196 mini-project has updated the configuration of all locations. This changed the Approval that was previously Skipped to "Basic Approval".
VIP and VIP99 locations must skip approval on all statements.
The new configuration "Double Budgeting" is configuration to skip approval, while "Business travel" is basic approval process

Could you please add "skip approval" on the configration for VIP and VIP99 locations

Location: VIP and VIP99 / All DE location
Update point: Skip Approval process. Direct to Audit process
All statement: "Business Trip" configuration

"CwfAudit" is set in the "Double Budgeting" configuration.

Matthias adviced to me that the setting is that way, that only travel scheme "DHF" uses the workflow via FDF "expense.cwfAudit", not the travel scheme "business travel".double housekeeping is the new travel scheme! I think they only want to have it for the other travel scheme "business trip". But in that case it's not easy. You can't set a workflow in the travel scheme file, that doesn't work. We put the workflow setting in the system config file and say through a FDF value, that only "DHF" travel scheme should switch to the workflow and not business trip. So... we have to combine the two workflows to one at the end

<dataFieldDescriptor code = "cwfAudit" type = "List" defaultValue = "false" feature = "$ \{CYTRIC_EXPENSE_BUSINESS_CODE}" elementLinkType = "net.ifao.vegas.domain.expense.StringLink" elementLinkRole = "expense.cwfAudit">
 <assignTo>
 <assign type = "$ \{CLASS_ExpenseStatement}" />
 </ assignTo>
 <nameTranslation>
 <name locale = "en_US"> isAuditActivated </ name>
 <name locale = "de_DE"> isAuditActivated </ name>
 </ nameTranslation>
 <descriptionTranslation>
 <name locale = "en_US"> isAuditActivated </ name>
 <name locale = "de_DE"> isAuditActivated </ name>
 </ descriptionTranslation>
 <roles />
 <values>
 <item value = "true" />
 <item value = "false" />
 </ values>
 </ dataFieldDescriptor>

Best regards,
Yutaka

column1: Apleona - HSG export needs to be overworked - based on ITE-174
column26:
In some cases the cost center will not be exported and then the attribute <Kostenstelle> is empty in the export file.

Based on analyses from ITE-174 this is caused by the custom specific export and in this the field cost center will be deleted to often.
This is at the moment causing that the cost center will not be exported for receipts or mileage; it will only be exported for per diems and meal deductions.
Find two exports attached, one is NOK as <Kostenstelle> is empty (export done on 12.July); the second one is OK (export done on 6.July)

Additionally some further points had been found in the code that are not correct.

column1: Apleona - HSG - filename prefix corrections
column26:
based on ITE-173 it turned out that the following code is missing in the HSG configs
 
<FDF code="expense.attachments.file.prefix.fdf.code">
 <item value="FileNamePrefix" /> 
</FDF>

column1: Apleona - prefix of attachments load onto sftp server not correct
column26:
The following issue may be related to ITE-147.

Although the names of the export files are ok again, now the customer realized that the names of the attachments are not correct.
In the past the naming was correctly statementID-statementID-00-0....
Now it is a 10-digit number+"-statementID-00-0...". It is even not clear what kind of number this 10-digit number is, it might be a VK-Ref. The number is not used in the statement.

Problem for the customer: as the attachment-files are not starting with the statement ID, the files and the statement cannot match in the accounting system.

I was not able to find a reason for this in the custom specific configuration.
Also I did not check all statement IDs listed, but all I checked where related to location HSG Zander Südost
column291: 13/Jul/21 11:22 PM;ngraf;wrong project was chosen - closed CI and opened ITE-173;;;

column1: Hensoldt:SSO email link not working
column74: 12/Jul/21 9:01 AM;nsanchez;Kostenabrechnung ID 6010525 ( Andreas Lambrecht ) wurde an Sie zur weiteren Bearbeitung delegiert..msg;https://jira.ifao.net/secure/attachment/118138/Kostenabrechnung+ID+6010525+%28+Andreas+Lambrecht+%29+wurde+an+Sie+zur+weiteren+Bearbeitung+delegiert..msg
column291:
13/Jul/21 1:44 PM;lanfermann;There are few things why this does not work:
  
 * [https://mega.cytric.net/svc/SAML2/cWS/pre/AUTH?clientId=HENSOLDT|https://mega.cytric.net/svc/SAML2/cWS/pre/AUTH?clientId=SAMLBCDHENSOLDT] the link that they use is not pointing to the expense approval but just to log in, plus it uses the incorrect Client ID (Hensoldt). In https://jira.ifao.net/browse/ITS-16869 it was checked that for this Client ID, there is no valid metadata loaded
 * There is actually another Client ID created which is valid - https://jira.ifao.net/browse/ITS-16714 with login URL [https://mega.cytric.net/svc/SAML2/cWS/pre/AUTH?clientId=SAMLBCDHENSOLDT]
 * BCD did not request the correct client ID - for expense approval email it shoudl be SAP TOD, and they requested a standard SAML, so basically one which will just log them in to cytric
 * this was Patricia Prieto from BCD who was working on this, so possibly the person who logged this case should contact her to request the correct Client ID
 * then there is also some work on customer side to be done, which is described here: [https://confluence.secure.ifao.net/display/EXTRNL/Expense+statement+link+from+email] , they can do that on their own, or Patricia could request an Integration project from Amadeus;;;

column1: Allianz UK - difference between credit and debit
column26:
Export is causing an error in the SAP of the customer, because the debit and the credit is different:

debit: 341.86 GBP
credit: 345.86 GBP

difference of 4.00 GBP
this statement contains a per diem for Algerian of 4.00 GBP

This per diems of 4.00 GBP are listed to be part of the sum of 345.86, but there is no debit posting existing for the per diems, so that in the end the amounts do not fit.
column291:
19/Jul/21 5:15 PM;mkuchciak;Hello [~ngraf],

With reliable Engine Team assistance I found a root cause of the discrepancy between debit and credit.
For UK-Allianz Management Services Ltd there is no per diem set (external code, posting key etc.). As instance per diem is set for Allianz DE, snippet below.

!image-2021-07-19-17-02-15-008.png!

This is the reason why per diem from Algiera is not taken into consideration in terms of reimbursement for the statement owner. And this is also the reason why we have this discrepancy.

I noticed that for other AZ UK location (UK-Allianz Global Corporate & Speciality SE) it's been solved that the per diem is fixed (35 GBP) no matter in what country the cost was made.
!image-2021-07-19-17-10-29-293.png!

I suggest to confirm with the customer if they would prefer to have the same approach in UK-Allianz Management Services Ltd as they have in UK-Allianz Global Corporate & Speciality SE.

Thank you! :);;;
column292:
02/Aug/21 10:57 PM;ngraf;clarified with customer: customer wishes to remove the 4 GBP per diems as they are not paying those 4 GBP per diems

So, we need country_per_diems_fix_values.txt in engine-configs/CalculationConfiguration/ama-de-allianz/gb/default/20170101-99990101/3511110607 with values:

GB~UNITED KINGDOM~0~0~0~0~0~GBP
FOREIGN~Ausland#Foreign~0~0~0~0~0~GBP

 

Thanks, Nicole;;;
column293: 04/Aug/21 1:50 PM;ngraf;Bali system not working properly, hence verified on Staging -> verification OK;;;

13/Jul/21 12:31 PM;yutaka;[~lanfermann] 
Hello Uwe san,

Could you please tell me the root cause of this issue and what you have fixed?
OEBB can't test because it doesn't have booking data, so I'm asking for clarification.

I checked the modified engine source. please check the my understanding as bellow,
The G / L Account to be posted was different due to a problem with the Posting Record of Generation calculation logic. There was a problem with the "paid by company" code, which affected all posting codes. We have fixed the code for "964Z" so that other G / L accounts will also be posted with the correct code.

customer feedback:

Antwort
 
Bitte nochmals um Analyse welche Reisekostenabrechnungen tatsächlich von dem Fehler betroffen sind!!

Der Fehler in den Lohnarten kann im staging nicht getestet werden (z.B. Flug müsste tatsächlich gebucht werden um "vom Arbeitgeber bezahlt" Lohnart zu erhalten und zu testen). Wir benötigen daher dringend eine Analyse der betroffenen Reisekostenabrechnungen.

Bitte um Rückmeldung was überhaupt korrigiert wurde.

Vielen Dank!;;;

column293:
07/Jul/21 1:41 PM;brogala;Hello [~yutaka],

 

From what I can see in code and in the log, it is not a bug but a validation error purposefully build.

An error occures when prefecture code (which is set up on user profile level) does not match a list hardcoded in cutom logic.

When they do not match and error label appears saying: "Prefecture code not found".

User might have mistake in that code - which would be causing an error.

 

Best regards,

Bartosz;;;

 User received the daily allowance for reduced amount on EUR14.
 Credit posting recode is correct in the amount of EUR112 (EUR14 x 8 days) but, Debit posting recode was incorrect at EUR196 (EUR28 X6 + EUR14 X2).

column1: Vaillant - missing or invalid data error for "error.expense.200017"
column26:
Hello team,

We got the missing or invalid data for "error.expense.200017"

We get an error on the receipt so We can't calculate it

Sample ES: 5237087
 !image-2021-06-30-15-41-11-150.png|width=615,height=278!

 

I already opened the ITE tickets (ITE-143). and Martin mentioned to me that the this issue is this behavior is triggered by an erroneous configuration.

Please adjust the configuration.
{code:java}
      <FDF code="TaxRateFlightDomestic">
        <item value="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regular" />
      </FDF>
      <FDF code="TaxRateFlightNonDomestic">
        <item value="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.none" />
      </FDF>
{code}
The customer configuration (ES Saunier Duval Clima S.A.U. location configuration)

ONLY allows following tax rates for flight:
{code:java}
          <typeOfReceipt code="expense.basereceipt.receipt.ticket.flight" defaultTaxRate="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reducedAlt">
            <taxRates>
              <taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reducedAlt" />
              <taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reduced_4" />
            </taxRates>
          </typeOfReceipt>
{code}
So the domestic/foreign tax rate is not allowed for this receipt, this triggers the error.

 

We  needs add to configure on location level (all locations that do not use none and  regular tax rates):
{code:java}
      <dataFieldDescriptor code="TaxRateFlightDomestic" type="Text">
        <assignTo>
          <assign type="${CLASS_TimedConfiguration}" />
        </assignTo>
        <nameTranslation>
          <name locale="en_US">Default tax rate for domestic flight</name>
          <name locale="de_DE">Default tax rate for domestic flight</name>
        </nameTranslation>
        <descriptionTranslation>
          <name locale="en_US">Default tax rate for domestic flight</name>
          <name locale="de_DE">Default tax rate for domestic flight</name>
        </descriptionTranslation>
      </dataFieldDescriptor>      
      <dataFieldDescriptor code="TaxRateFlightNonDomestic" type="Text">
        <assignTo>
          <assign type="${CLASS_TimedConfiguration}" />
        </assignTo>
        <nameTranslation>
          <name locale="en_US">Default tax rate for non domestic flight</name>
          <name locale="de_DE">Default tax rate for non domestic flight</name>
        </nameTranslation>
        <descriptionTranslation>
          <name locale="en_US">Default tax rate for non domestic flight</name>
          <name locale="de_DE">Default tax rate for non domestic flight</name>
        </descriptionTranslation>
      </dataFieldDescriptor>      
      <FDF code="TaxRateFlightDomestic">
        <item value="<<INSERT CORECT TAX RATE FOR DOMESTIC FLIGHT HERE>>" />
      </FDF>      
      <FDF code="TaxRateFlightNonDomestic">
        <item value="<<INSERT CORECT TAX RATE FOR INTERNATIONAL FLIGHTS HERE>>" />
      </FDF>
{code}
 


 Best regards,
 Yutaka

column1: Porsche - Reimbursement calculate error
column26: Hello team,   Since the receipt is “Paid by company”, the amount will not be reimbursed. But all amounts will be added as reimbursed. We simulated the case with a test statement 4856469 (see PDF attachments). Assumption: by stating Keine Pauschale zahlen (Porsche Standort mit Kantine) on Itinerary. - If the checkmark is not set, the reimbursement amount will be calculated correctly. - If the check mark is set, the reimbursement amount has been incorrectly calculated.   elementLinkRole="expense.absence.noPerDiemsPrivate"> ES: 4856469 User: Pieper, André (piepera@numiga.de) Reimbursement: All receipts and itineraries > 14,00 EUR Non-reimbursable amount > -75,50 EUR To be reimbursed > 89,50 EUR !image-2021-06-17-14-09-28-327.png|width=626,height=216!   !image-2021-06-17-14-09-56-071.png|width=613,height=129!           ExpenseAmountPaidByCompany                       75.5                           EUR               Euro                         GeneralExpenseAmountSum                       75.5                           EUR               Euro                   ES: 4823485 User: Krobath, Johann (JOHANN.KROBATH@PORSCHE.DE) All receipts and itineraries > 14,00 EUR Non-reimbursable amount > -105,00 EUR To be reimbursed > 119,00 EUR !image-2021-06-17-14-10-33-560.png|width=617,height=233! !image-2021-06-17-14-11-12-864.png|width=643,height=125!           ExpenseAmountPaidByCompany                       105.0                           EUR               Euro                                       1.0               2021-05-18T00:0                   GeneralExpenseAmountSum                       105.0                           EUR               Euro                         Best regards, Yutaka

column1: HeidelbergCement - userIdentificatonFdfCode needs to be corrected from personnelNumber to tmsCode employeenumber
column26:
based on ITE-83 the config for cc feeds needs to be changed for all identiefiers:

here example for the first identifier, same needs to be done for all following idetntifieres, too

from old:

<!-- START OF Company credit card feed settings -->
 <creditCardFeed identifier="DTB5682" tripIdEnrichmentCode="ORDERNUMBER" userIdentificationEnrichmentCode="PERSONALID" userIdentificationFdfCode="personnelNumber" creditCardNumberMatchEnabled="true" paidByCompanyBillingTypes="C,CMPNY,ZY" />

 

into new:

<!-- START OF Company credit card feed settings -->
 <creditCardFeed identifier="DTB5682" tripIdEnrichmentCode="ORDERNUMBER" userIdentificationEnrichmentCode="PERSONALID" userIdentificationFdfCode="employeenumber" creditCardNumberMatchEnabled="true" paidByCompanyBillingTypes="C,CMPNY,ZY" />

 

 

_____________________________________________________________________

additional info 18.05.2021

also the ORDERNUMBER needs to be changed into PROJECTNUMBER

column1: ÖBB - Rights KV company agreement
column26:
Hello Team,

 

ÖBB bring up that their employee Mario Nuser (20093590) in location "ÖBB Stadler Service GmbH, Wien" had the following error message when he tried to submit the statement 6139915.

 

"Selection only possible for employees of the KV company agreement"

 

ÖBB told us that a foreign trip to Switzerland must also be billable for this employee (metal trade employee).

 

Please could you update the rights ?

 

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
column291:
17/May/21 8:09 PM;mstaszek;Hello Sandra :) 

Problem is not a foreign trip to Switzerland.

In the past we received a requirement that using this type of accommodation should not be possible for other collective agreement groups (Kollektivvertrag).
It can be used only by (BV_OEBB)
Please check this ticket [#https://jira.ifao.net/browse/CI-3779]

User in this statement is from kv_metall_ang collective agreement group.

Please clarify with customer and let me know how we should proceed.

Thank you!.;;;
column292:
21/May/21 12:50 PM;ssanz;Hi [~mstaszek], Please find below the customer's answer, hope that can help you to make changes. Thank you. Best regards, Sandra

 

"Auch Mitarbeiter mit dem KV "Metallgewerbe Angestellter" (arbeitsrechtliche Grundlage) und auch "Metallgewerbe Arbeiter" (arbeitsrechtliche Grundlage) fahren auf Dienstreise ins Ausland und müssen daher abgerechnet werden.

Weiters wurde festgelegt, dass in diesem Fall die gesamten Diäten als Auslandsdiäten zu verbuchen sind."

 

"Employees with the KV "Metallgewerbe Angestellter" (basis under labour law) and also "Metallgewerbe Arbeiter" (basis under labour law) also travel abroad on business and must therefore be accounted for.

Furthermore, it has been determined that in this case the entire allowances are to be accounted for as foreign allowances.";;;

column1: MAN-ES: fix the JavaScript for the export
column26:
* [https://travel.cytric.net/ibe?system=man-es]
 * @travel
 * name:man-es

h2. +current issue:+

ref: https://jira.ifao.net/browse/ITE-50

 job export : 331859 is stuck due to:

 

*Problem:*

The command terminated with exeception. Mark result as Failed for process 53657812:

net.ifao.vegas.framework.Failure: net.ifao.vegas.framework.Failure: org.mozilla.javascript.EcmaError: TypeError: Cannot call method "getValue" of null

 

The stuck export is caused by an erroneous export configuration. It is not appropriate to unstuck the export without fixing the erroneous export script in advance as subsequent exports would fail again.

According to the error message (see comments) the issue is caused by a missing null check when calling getValue() - most likely when trying to receive a value from a non existing FDF.

Please liaise with Delivery and record an appropriate CI-Issue to fix the JavaScript for the export. Afterwards, please either create a new ITE or re-open this ITE to request to unstuck the export again

column1: Apleona - wrong tax key in xml file
column26:
System: apleona
server: MEGA

Dear team,

Customer is complaining that when selecting the tax rate 10.7% this tax rate is wrongly displayed as 110. It seems that the number is rounded from 10.7 (107) to 11 (110).

Please check the screenshots to clarify:

Statement receipt with tax 10.7%:

!image-2021-04-07-20-01-57-630.png|width=591,height=324!

The tax rate is correctly displayed in statement report:

!image-2021-04-07-20-03-06-543.png|width=544,height=516!

The XML export file has this information: 110 instead of 107

!image-2021-04-07-20-06-13-187.png|width=507,height=681!

Test Statement: 5972774
user: Udo Weinfurtner
date: 2021-03-30
Accounted at: 30.03.2021 12:47

After investigation in ITE-16, Oliver Buerger informed that the issue is caused by the fact that the format of column TAX_RATE in vegas DB table POSTING_RECORD is with just 2 decimals.

!image-2021-04-09-16-22-53-824.png!

Hence, even though the cytric Expense Engine provides the correct value for <taxRate> in the response that is sent to cE Core, it is rounded to 2 decimals (0.107 will be rounded to 0.11).

!image-2021-04-09-16-25-19-189.png|width=627,height=260!

 

!image-2021-04-09-16-26-45-327.png!

 

The JavaScript that is used to calculate the value of element <Mwst-Gruppe2/> is based on the value of postingRecord.taxRate.
{code:java}
...
var taxRate = postingRecord.taxRate; // rounded to 0.11 due to format of the column
var modifiedTaxRate = taxRate + "";
modifiedTaxRate = modifiedTaxRate.substring(modifiedTaxRate.indexOf(".") + 1);
if(modifiedTaxRate.length == 2){
  modifiedTaxRate += 0;
}
...
writeElement("Mwst-Gruppe2", modifiedTaxRate, indent + 4);
...{code}
 

A potential workaround might be to use postingRecord.taxRateKey (which is 107) instead.

Could you please go ahead in this workaround?
Thanks and best regards, 

Debora de Carvalho
column201:
System: apleona
server: MEGA
all locations

column1: TUI - adapting system TUI-UAT ONLY
column26:
For *engine only*, not related to vegas!

As the test system [https://amadeus.cytric.net/ama-de-TUI-UAT] differs to much from the system on server bali and from the prod system, it is needed to adapt ama-de-TUI-UAT to be like ama-de-TUI (engine part).

This is needed as elsewise new implementations, first done on bali and verified on bali, would need an own second implementation on ama-de-TUI-UAT that cannot be compared with the first implementation on Bali.
 If the customer then would verify the new implementation on ama-de-TUI-UAT and gives GO for production, on productions finally not the code from UAT would be implemented, but the code from bali, which the customer was not able to test.
 Also it is too much effort to create two different implementations for the same CI.

Therefor it was decided to adapt ama-de-TUI-UAT so that it is identical to prod again. 
 Afterwards it might happen that already finished implementations on UAT that are not yet implemented on prod, might need to be implemented again.

column1: Hugo boss – wrong export file (IDOC)
column26:
Hello Team,

 

We received incident the wrong export file from Hugo boss.

The problem is that the line of the traveler (Employee number) must be always the number 1.

 

in case of car rental, They have some fixed vendors in In Ticino(CH) location.
 The IDOC segment E1BPACAP09, in case a User rent a car from this vendor, appear twice.
 So ONLY for Ticino, we should have multiple vendor line option (segment E1BPACAP09) in which the first is ALWAYS the Traveler one (Employee number) and the second or more refers to the following car rental vendors:

E1BPACAP09/ Car vender
 Car Rental (Avis) 6040107 B0 - no vat 25

Car Rental (Hertz) 6027506 B0 - no vat 25

Car Rental (Sixt) 6004710 B0 - no vat 25

column291:
17/Mar/21 7:25 PM;mstaszek;Hello [~yutaka] san,

Current setup is
 * vegas config: validation from booking
 * TMS config: from booking and and this FDF display only during booking flow

In order to see the values in this field:
 * you need to have corresponding booking
 AND/OR
 * change setup in TMS so the FDF is available in user profile also (check attachment provided blue box)

and add in vegas validation with from.fixed.list e.g.

 
{code:java}
<validation>
  <from.traveler>
    <fall.back.on>
      <from.user>
        <constraint>
          <from.fixed.list />
        </constraint>
      </from.user>
    </fall.back.on>
  </from.traveler>
</validation>{code}
 

[https://confluence.secure.ifao.net/display/Expense/Free+Data+Field+Configuration]

[https://confluence.secure.ifao.net/display/VEGAS/Free+Data+Fields+Import]

{color:#00875a}{color:#e8bf6a}
 {color:#172b4d}You need to clarify what is needed in this situation.{color}{color}{color}
{color:#172b4d} Let me know how to proceed ;){color}

 ;;;

column1: Numiga-Master wrong calculation of income tax relevant per diems
column26:
If there is receipt "Verpflegungskosten" and some per diems paid for the given day, the difference should be calculated as income tax relevant per diems.

 

for example (attached screenshot):

receipt sum = 40€

daily allowance = 14€

income tax relevant = (40-14) = 26€

column291:
07/Mar/21 2:43 PM;salajan;!image-2021-03-07-14-37-43-845.png!

the periods need to be aligned............. whatever we choose at point 3

1. the easiest (without having the customer context) is to split the larger period into smaller ones and duplicating files:

default/20180101-99990101 becomes default/20180101-20180401, default/20180401-20210101 and default/20210101-99990101

and

dienstreise/20180101-20210101 becomes dienstreise/20180101-20180401 and dienstreise/20180401-20210101

 

2. don't forget to adapt the accounting configuration class ;)

3. finally, the following file is needed in the system folder (if we want to allow it):

!image-2021-03-07-15-00-53-973.png!

[~yutaka]san do you know what we should choose here? I will explain:

if there are multiple folders with dates in engine, if the user tries to create a statement "across" the 2 folders, this results in the error here present. example:

20200101-20210101 and 20210101-20220101 are present. If I create a statement containing receipts from Dec 2020 *and* Jan 2021, it will result in an error. Calculating across multiple folders is, by default, not permitted.

We can allow it, but we have to decide which folder applies to the whole statement. We *cannot* apply multiple folders to the same statement.

In the example above, if we choose relevant date = firstAbsence, the first folder will apply to the whole statement. We also have the possibility to choose the last one..

2 decisions to be taken here [~yutaka] san:
 * Do we allow calculation over multiple periods?
 * If yes, which folder should be considered (first or last).;;;

The accounting periods for this customer are:

!image-2021-03-17-10-43-35-419.png!

A statement can only be part of 1 period, by definition.

 

If the customer has a statement that spans across 2 or more of the periods above, they need to split the statement OR tell us which folder to use: 1 statement can only be calculated with 1 configuration.

 

2 solutions:

1. they split the statement in parts that fit in 1 folder for each statement

OR

2. they tell us which folder to apply: it can be the earliest one, or the latest one.

 

hope this is clear;;;
column296:
19/Mar/21 8:45 AM;yutaka;[~salajan] 
Hello Mircea san,
Thank you for your update.

They want to calculate receipts for 2020 and 2021 at the same time.
Is it possible to be able to calculate 20180401-20210101 and 20210101-9999010 same time?;;;
column297:
19/Mar/21 9:06 AM;salajan;Hello [~yutaka]  san,

 

It is possible to calculate a statement with receipts from 2020 and 2021. BUT the customer needs to tell us which configuration to apply.

 

Even though, the statement contains receipts from 2020 and 2021, we can only apply 1 of the 2 configurations. And they need to choose.

 

The only possible choices are:  earliest one or latest one.;;;

Not feedback from customer.

I will close it;;;

column1: ÖBB - Labour legal basis - NONE- no calculation of reimbursement amounts in Expense
column26:
Hello Team,

ÖBB asked to change the behaviour when the legal basis is in "KEINE".

Today the Statement accounting is based on the BV and should not be.

They want there will have the error message:  "No Expense Report can be created because of lack of employment law bases."

German version :"Diese RK-Abrechnung kann nicht erstellt werden, da keine arbeitsrechtlichen Grundlagen vorliegen."

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra

+Here the customer asking in german :+

MEGA, Version: 19.0.8 (der Fehler trat auch in allen Versionen davor auf)

IST:

Derzeit wird bei einer arbeitsrechtlichen Grundlage "KEINE" die RK-Abrechnung auf Basis der BV erstellt.

Das ist nicht korrekt

SOLL:

Es darf kein Erstattungsbetrag berechnet werden. Beim Speichern der RK-Abrechnung soll ein Fehler angezeigt werden - "Diese RK-Abrechnung kann nicht erstellt werden, da keine arbeitsrechtlichen Grundlagen vorliegen." Und das Speichern der RK-Abrechnung soll nicht möglich sein.

Englischer Fehlertext: No Expense Report can be created because of lack of employment law bases.

 

Umsetzung soll zuerst in staging erfolgen.

 

Betroffene Kostenabrechnungen: 5455809 (Manuel Zeilinger), 5455773 (Manuel Zeilinger)

column291:
18/Feb/21 10:16 AM;nsanchez;client comment:

 

Cytric Expense posting data is inconsistent (debit balance) and cannot be processed in SAP, as described by Jeanette.;;;
column292:
18/Feb/21 2:04 PM;devries;Hello! ;) 
The mistake depends on the former splitting, there were once cost center FDF and order number FDF which splitted the posting amounts in the way the user set the percentage at each FDF. There was a custom logic to calculate it. In vegas-config from 1.10.2020 there is no splitting any more, but the custom logic is still there in the period from 1.11.2018 to  29.1.2021, that's why the debit postings stuckes. I corrected the engine periods and removed the custom logic.;;;

column1: Rheinmetall (RWM) - Expense Arranger didn't see their traveler's unassigned expenses
column26:
Dear Team,

 

 Rheinmetall said that some Expense Arrangers who have just the rights for some Locations (here for RMW) can not see the Unassigned expenses for some travelers who are located in RMW and even if the arranger has been added in the user profile.

 

On the other side, if the Arranger has the rights for all locations, he can see the unassigned expenses for all travelers even for that missed before.

 

+e.g.+ : I tested on my side and if I have the rights for all locations I can see Herr Knöpfle's unassigned expenses. But if I have just the right for RMW, I can not see him even if I am on his profile as Active Expense Arrangers.

 

Please could you investigate ?

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
column291:
11/Feb/21 3:12 PM;ngraf;Same problem for [https://travel.cytric.net/ibe?system=CMS] (Case 2-15381155563)

Seems to be related to some travelers only.
Example for traveler Mr. Brockhoff
- if the arranger has only the Expense Arranger right for the traveler's location (105 CMS Hasche Sigle Partnerschaft von Rechtsanwaelten und Steuerberatern MBB, Stuttgart), then the Expense Arranger cannot see the unassigned receipt from 08.02.2020
On the other side, the Expense Arranger can see several unassigned receipts from users from this location. 
- as soon as the same arranger is getting Expense Arranger rights for ALL locations, then the unassigned receipt is listed and can be used to create a new statement
This is reproducible with several users as Expense Arranger.;;;

column1: CMS - remove blank line from taxrates.txt
column26:
As it seems a blank line within file

engine/CalculationConfiguration/cmshs/be/default/20140101-99990101/tax_rates.txt

is causing the problem that German tax rates cannot be used for receipts with location Germany and are ending up with error when calculating the statement.

Error is on statement level: A validation error occurred during the last attempt to calculate this expense statement.
On receipt level: Country and/or tax rate not permitted (for this type of receipt)

 

Therefore please change from old

"
# Tax rates
# Format:
# countryCode~Key~rate
BE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regularAlt~0.21
BE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reducedAlt~0.06
 
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.none~0.00
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reduced~0.07
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regular~0.19
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.0500~0.05
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.1600~0.16
"
 
 
to new

"
# Tax rates
# Format:
# countryCode~Key~rate
BE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regularAlt~0.21
BE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reducedAlt~0.06
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.none~0.00
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reduced~0.07
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regular~0.19
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.0500~0.05
DE~expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.1600~0.16
"
 
As I did not find any other reason what might cause the errors (in the past it worked fine), there is currently no other Jira ticket open. If you are aware of another reason than the one mentioned above, please let me know.

column26:
Hello Team,

Hope you are going well.

Rheinmetall said us that the statements which have only others types of document (parking, fuel, ...) <100€ without itinerary, shouldn't be submitted to approval but today we found some which arrived in approval.

This should work like this :

 -for one day trips up to Euro 100 in sum of all receipts NO approval is necessary and should lead directly to audit, over Euro 100 it needs to go to approval

- If receipt types flight, train, rental car and hotel are contained the workflow should trigger approval

- receipt types parking, fuel, ONLY e.g. should be allowed and could skip approval if sum < 100 EUR

Please could you check and correct this behaviour ?

Customer asked that to be implement first at the Rheinmetall AG test site and RME test site.

And if the tests on the test systems are successful after implementation, they'll ask to transfer them to the productive locations.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra
column264: Rheinmetall AG test site and RME test site
column292:
16/Feb/21 1:03 PM;fkazmierczak;As confirmed by the Customer via Email:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
The existing workflow that is now used by all locations should be enhanced in the following area - single trip below 100 EUR. If all of following conditions are met at the same time Approval step (both first and final one should be skipped):
# sum all of expenses (including receipts paid by company and mileage allowance) is below 100 EUR
# it is a one-day trip below 8 hours (no per diem paid)
# the Expense Statements contains only following receipt types:
* "expense.basereceipt.receipt.rheinmetall.taxi"
* "expense.basereceipt.receipt.rheinmetall.petrol"
* "expense.basereceipt.receipt.ticket.rheinmetall.public.transportation"
* "expense.basereceipt.receipt.car.private"
* "expense.basereceipt.receipt.rheinmetall.parking"
If at least one of above conditions is NOT met - then first level of Approval is required.

At first the newly created Workflow should be used only in test locations in MEGA. After successful test from customer the Workflow should be copied to all locations - including production ones(BALI and MEGA).

In Expense project copy workflow of "RHEINMETALL" and create a new one called "RHEINMETALLUPDATED". The difference should be done only in the area described above. The rest should stay untouched.;;;

column294:
08/Mar/21 1:39 PM;lanfermann;Feedback from [~achattopadhyay]:
About the 9320 wage, the objective is to set the tax free perdiem allowance in that wage type
So, in a normal exp statement  it should be the total perdiem amount set to that wage. The meal deductions if any will need to be deducted first and then the final perdiem that will be reimbursed is set.

And in a 3 month rule case, if perdiems are being paid after the 90 day mark, then the sum total of perdiems until the 90th day minus meal deductions if any should be set as the wage.
Anything beyond the 90 day mark is taxable and should be excluded from the calculation
;;;

column1: OEBB - wrong calculation in Austrian per diem
column26:
For OEBB - bv-oebb the per diems AT are calculated based on hours: if the traveller is away for more than 3 hours, 2,20 EUR will be paid per hour (max. 26,40 EUR). In addition the per diems are calculated based on 24 hour and not based on calendar day.

This is working fine as long as the trip is not a combination of domestic AT and abroad.

*Problem:* 
If it is a combination of domestic and abroad, the trip is starting in AT, then abroad and the last segment is again domestic AT, then the final last segment will only be paid with per diems if it is more than 3 hours (although the whole trip was already several days)

Example:
Wien AT - 01.12.2020 20:00 - 21:27
Verona IT - 01.12.2020 21:27 - 03.12.2020 13:01
Wien AT - 03.12.2020 13.01 - 22:15
-->
per diems will be 
- 31 EUR for 01.12. 20:00 - 02.12. 20:00 (31 EUR are statutory for IT based on country AT)
- 31 EUR for 02.12. 20:00 - 03.12. 20:00
- no per diems are calculated for the last 2,25 hours (03.12. 20:00-22:15)
- But as soon as 03.12.22:15 will be changed into 23:01 (3:01 hours in total), then 8,80 EUR will be calculated by Expense

*Solution needed:*
Customers expectation is to have calculated 4,40 EUR (2*2,20 EUR) for the last 2,25 hours.

As this is not a single trip =< 3 hours, in such a case we need a more specific check. 
Especially the check needs to cover timeframe based on the end of the 24-hours-timeframe for an absence. In this example you can see that based on the 24-hours-timeframe instead of calendar date, the last absence Wien is finally divided into two absences: 13:01-20:00 and 20:00-22:15



Find attached reports of a statement (test done on [https://staging.cytric.net/oebb-test)] where you can see the calculation based on example 22:15 compared with 23:00 for the trip end date.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra
column291:
13/Jan/21 9:26 AM;salajan;Hi [~ssanz] ,

When cancelling an export in cytric, SAP is not informed of this. This means that cancelling an export and re-exporting the same statement, it will be sent to SAP twice.

The accounting flow from cytric to SAP is one way only.

A check needs to be added in SAP to avoid double posting but nothing else can be done in cytric.;;;

column292:
08/Jan/21 3:40 PM;lanfermann;Hi Yutaka, I had a chat with Marius about this topic and he explained to me that this calculated correctly because:
 * all mileage allowance for HLS is set to 0, meaning the mileage reimbursement becomes 0
 * therefore professional expenses (Werbungskosten) are present, because the employer paid less then what the traveller should have gotten by market template

To "adjust the logic of the travel cost calculation for the above-mentioned location in accordance with the other locations." like you requested, we would need to set the mileage allowances to the same amount like in the other configurations, is that wanted? If they want to keep them at 0, we could remove the "professional expenses", although I am not sure if this is allowed by law;;;
column293:
12/Jan/21 8:01 AM;yutaka;Hello [~lanfermann] san,
Thank you for your feedback!

Do they have two options?
1. The total mileage allowance sum is "0" and remove professional expenses (Werbungskosten)
2. Calculate mileage allowance like any other location

Thank you and regards,

Yutaka;;;
column294:
12/Jan/21 9:50 AM;lanfermann;Hi [~yutaka] san,

REWE has two options:

1. Set the mileage allowance for HLS from 0 (as it is now) to the same amount like the other REWE configs have. This way, all calculations would be the same like in the other configurations, resulting in the 180€ from this example being added to the Kilometer Euro sums (Mileage Allowance) instead of the Professional Expenses (the Professional Expenses won't be removed, just significantly lower. Please note that the Professional Expenses are calculated right at the moment, based on the Mileage Allowance which is 0)

2. Set the Professional Expenses to 0 for the value that results of the current difference between the Mileage Allowance REWE wants to pay (0€) and what they should pay according to german law (180€). This is technically more challenging, and I don't know if it is even allowed by law.

I would suggest to approach REWE only with option 1, as I think this is what they want. If they want something else, they can request it from us themselves.;;;

column1: DER - change custom logic to use the location.id
column26:
Customer: DER

System: der-co-sas

server: WORLD

 

Hello team!

Could you please help me with this request?

(You can check the CE-3059 if necessary)

 

Customer is complaining that no SEPA file was created for location SAS Autosystemtechnik GmbH, Wolfsburg.

After investigation in CE-3059, we conclude  SEPA file will only be generated for Germany when the user is from a specific location.

When the user is from Germany the SEPA file will be generated for locations:

- SAS Autosystemtechnik GmbH & Co KG, Wolfsburg

- Autosystemtechnik GmbH & Co KG, Zwickau

 

As the affected user is on location SAS Autosystemtechnik GmbH, Wolfsburg, the SEPA file is not generated.

Please change the custom logic to use the *location.id* and not the *location.name* and a renaming of the location will not cause any problems in the future.

Please let me know if you need further information.

Best regards,

Débora de Carvalho

column1: BCD-AT-LKW: wrong export
column26:
h2. +current issue:+

after roll back of CI-4068,

+we need to implement correctly their exports:+

ref: CI-4068 CI-3849

{color:#00875a}1-.{color}*if there is a parking fee receipt, the mileage allowances should always go to account 246(subject to income tax) and no to 249* *(no subject to tax)*

+accounts:+
249"= "KM-Geld Erstattungen Inland (no taxable)

"249"= "KM-Geld Erstattungen Ausland",   

"246"= "steuerpflichtige KM-Geld Erstattungen Inland (taxable)

"246"= "steuerpflichtige KM-Geld Erstattungen Ausland"

 

{color:#00875a}2 {color}- in the export for the accounts, the *meal deductions* should be displayed in negative 

 

{color:#00875a}3-{color} the *total diets* should be positive and not negative as it is now,

 

{color:#00875a}4-{color} meal deductions should be summed up with diets

 

{color:#00875a}5-{color} Km money *should not be show* as partial amount 

 

     *examples  attached on excel of how it should be configured(wrong statements)

     *example of correct files: id 5550381

 
h2. +steps to reproduce+

user for testing: [dominik.barna@lkw-walter.com|mailto:dominik.barna@lkw-walter.com] 

*1-*create statement with parameters:

  a- mandat 120

  b- perdiem austria at least 2 days

  c- km for  two different dates 1 passanger (example 72km)

  d- at least 2 meals

  e- you can  add a parking fee receipt to test 246

  f- you can no add parking fee receipt to test account 249

*2-* submit Id

*3-* a different user should audit the statement

*4-* as an accountant export the id

*5-* after the test *{color:#de350b}cancel the export ***very important***{color}*

- The export contains 3 files:

    !image-2020-12-21-10-03-12-049.png!

that should be displayed as id5550381

*6*- once created, you can use the same ID for future testings, you just have to recalculate it first and then re-export

 

thank you

column1: EnBW - conditional workflow adaption related to CE-3042 - all statements with itineraries abroad must run into audit
column26:
Based on Bug CE-3042 all statements containing at least on itinerary abroad (based on origin country DE) must run into audit process.

Therefore please enhance the validation to NOT skip audit process if any itinerary is NOT country DE.

This implementation should only be active until release change including a fix for CE-3042.
--> all statements with an itinerary abroad between today until release change 19.x in which CE-3042 is fixed should be sent into the audit process, audit process is not allowed to be skipped
 --> as soon as CE-3042 (or maybe a related cytric Jira ticket based on CE-3042) is deployed to production, the workflow should be redone to original (means it should be again like the day before this CI-4341 was implemented)

column1: ÖBB - New calculation for sleeping car wage tax-free (865F)
column26:
Sleeping car Requirements as discussed with customer on 20.04.2021

1. Implement only for Betriebsvereinbarung (BV) (/)

 2. Applies ones per night only
    - Apply custom logic that it can be used ones per day only (/) (there is a validator keeping the user from submitting more than one accomodation per day)

 3. Sleeping car usage replaces the general overnight per diem

 the user can either select

    - Accommodation / employment agreement
    - Private
    - Sleeping car

    Apply custom logic only one of three can be entered per day (/) (see 2.)

4. Payment amount for sleeping car is 65,41 per night (/)

5. Account booking (/)

column1: Allianz : Please add tax rate code for receipt type
column26:
Please add tax rate code for reduced tax rates "7%" for hotel breakfast and hotel seminar fee.

Fyi. Customer comments

In Germany, VAT rates still differ temporarily for food and beverages. Now reduced tax rate for food by 01.01.2021: 7%. Tax rates for beverages have already been implemented. 

 

(TAX rate code)

<behavior type="${CLASS_TaxRateBehavior}" code="taxRateCode">
 <typeName code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reduced">

<name locale="en_US">reduced (7%)</name>

<name locale="de_DE">reduziert (7%)</name>

 

(typeOfReceipts)

<add.country code="DE">

<typeOfReceipts>

 
 +*hotel.breakfast*+

<typeOfReceipt code="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.hotel.breakfast" defaultTaxRate="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.1600">

<taxRates>

<taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.none" />

<taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regular" />

<taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.0500" />

<taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.1600" /
 **Please add to tax rate key for "taxRate.reduced*

 

+*hotel.seminar.fee*+

<typeOfReceipt code="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.hotel.seminar.fee" defaultTaxRate="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.1600">

<taxRates>

<taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.none" />

<taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.regular" />

<taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.0500" />

<taxRate code="expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.1600" />

 **Please add to tax rate key for "taxRate.reduced"*

Best regards,

Yutaka

column1: ProcuRX - Miscalculation of Per- diem of “hours calculation”
column26:
The travel day (moving day) is calculated as 24h regardless of the time calculate. The first and last days are calculated on time calculate.

 

Ex:

02/10/20 Athens, Greece

*00:00 - 06:00 24:00 Hours* / EUR137.23

03/10/20 AMS, Netherlands

*00:00 - 15:55 24:00 Hours* / EUR 274.46

!image-2020-12-07-18-56-34-304.png|width=529,height=116!

 

1st day

26/09/20 Athens, Greece

*09:15 - 24:00 14:45 Hours* / EUR 278.46

Last day

18/10/20 Tel Aviv, Israel

*00:00 - 23:05 23:05 Hours* / EUR270.16

!image-2020-12-07-18-57-15-326.png|width=525,height=68!

!image-2020-12-07-18-57-58-148.png|width=517,height=92!

server : Mega
 system : Procurx-pangea

Thank you
 Yutaka

column293:
21/Dec/20 3:03 PM;yutaka;Hello [~mstaszek]

Thank you for your reply.

"""The calculation is wrong."""
 The Per Diem "hours" calculation applies only for the departure day and the return to the origin city day.
 Hours calculation in only for the first and last days, all days between have to pay full daily allowance.

all the rest of the days should be calculated with the full amount - around 270 ILS.

in this report every flight day (oct.2nd for example) the traveler receive only EUR 137,23 (cytric calculates the hours) which is not right - it should be the full amount on EUR274,46

Duration is also listed in 24:00hours

ex.
 Currently, October 2nd is calculated with a 50% reduction. 137.23 EUR
 However, We have to reimbursement for Full daily allowance on October 2nd 274.46 EUR.

Please fix it immediately because the We received the push from the customer.

!image-2020-12-21-22-56-42-851.png|width=581,height=172!

 ;;;

column1: TUI UAT - WAGE 6021 doesn't works as expected
column26:
Dear Team,

 

Following the CI-3888, everything for WAGE 6021 works as expected in TUI ([https://amadeus.cytric.net/ama-de-TUI]).

But TUI told that it is not the same in TUI UAT ([https://amadeus.cytric.net/ama-de-TUI-UAT])

 

In attachment:

Test in PROD

Statement 40446560 (export 290027)

Wage 6021 works as expected

Test in TUI UAT

Statement 4255278 (export 290028)

Wage 6021 doesn't work as expected

 

Please could you do the necessary to ensure that the WAGE 6021 works as the same in TUI UAT as in TUI Prod ?

 

As reminder TUI wants to use " Amount" to be sent to the payroll. They want to have always the taxable amount into this field (for all 6021) and keep the other information in the "Net Amount".

 

Don't hesitate to contact me if I wasn't clear.

 

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: ÖBB - error message after chose the Trip Purpose "medical examination"
column26:
Hello Team,

Please could you investigate this case ?

ÖBB said that when an user try to create a statement, he got an error message regarding the reason for the trip purpose that he put or not the reason.

The arranger booked a trip and selected "medical examination" as the reason for the trip but when the user tried to create a cost statement, he got an error message regarding the reason for the trip (see attachment).

Example Statement #5390614

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra
column291:
23/Nov/20 12:01 PM;lanfermann;[~ssanz]
situation is as follows:
  * TRAVEL: user books a trip and enters a trip reason, e.g. "medical exam"
 * EXPENSE: user creates an expense statement. as it seems the trip reason there is set to e.g. "business trip" and cannot be changed by the user > *can you confirm this?*
 * then, we have a custom logic that checks if TRAVEL and EXPENSE trip reason match, and if not, the error from the CI is thrown

I would suggest that we re-write this logic and dont let it check if the trip reasons match, but set the EXPENSE trip reason to the TRAVEL trip reason.
 
What do you think? Should I just do this, or would you want to clarify with the customer? Can you confirm that the Expense user cannot change the trip reason anymore (because if he could, we wouldn't have an issue at all)? Do you have other ideas?;;;
