column74: 10/Nov/20 11:45 AM;nsanchez;3246695 Workshop New Sustainability Strategy - TUI Group.pdf;https://jira.ifao.net/secure/attachment/93397/3246695+Workshop+New+Sustainability+Strategy+-+TUI+Group.pdf
column291:
10/Nov/20 2:57 PM;nsanchez;updates from client:

{color:#0747a6}***quote**{color}

This issue is really important to be solved ASAP and really critical, as this is not an issue for only some certain claims, but for probably many claims. For all those claims we  have incorrect amounts in our HR system (payroll) as well as in our finance systems (for reimbursement AND accounting)! And we have no chance to control this.

 

At least this is an issue for the TBS-Trainees and probably for the TUI D apprentices. But maybe even for more. For us it is not possible to judge this!

 

My conclusions, based on the already attached data:

 

1) The export was wrong for the TBS-Trainees, therefor we have wrong data in HR and FI. do we have this for other employees, too? We don't know...

 

2) The report E021 does not show the exported amounts, but show the actual calculated amounts (based on the calculation rules of today).

 

3) The calculation rules for wages (6021 AND 9320) are not correct! Neither in the original export nor today in the E021. I doubt that the algorithm I described in my excel sheet is correct.

 

4) We recognized, that the PDF each employee can open in cytric expense for each claim (Download report), does not show the data exported for this claim, but shows the amounts calculated today. So these PDFs does not show the amounts send to FI and HR! But these PDF are used for taxation information.  

{color:#0747a6}***unquote**{color};;;

column302:
21/Jan/21 2:00 PM;nsanchez;From CI-10177079
carola advised to reply to client:
Dear Maren,

Thanks for the questions. Below you find an additional explanation to E021 report:

As a matter of fact, E021 does not calculate any amounts but reflects the already calculated data that is stored in statements included in the report at the time of report generation. Hence, E021 amounts might be different if configuration changes were applied over time.

 

In the meantime, we were able to figure out several parallel aspects in the TUI requests. This case here is related to the topic we are analyzing in case 2-15340530124, too. Due to this, we suggest closing this case, as the topic about differences between E021 and export files is finalized.

Within case 2-15340530124 we are currently testing the 3-month rule setup in general and for TBS. Hence, we can include the calculation topic of 6021 and 9320 in there, as it is part of the investigation.

Best regards;;;

column1: Rheinmetall - export is not allowed to contain negative amounts with a minus ("-")
column26:
It turned out that in some cases, exports do include negative amount including a minus ("-").
This is happening at least for negative amounts in statements of Rheinmetall.

With the original implementations it was missed to clarify with the customer how to handle negative amounts (minus "-") in the export over all companies and locations in general. 
With Case 2-15102233083 we got now the advise to handle all negative amount not with a minus ("-"), but to handle them as credits instead of debits.

Based on Case 2-15102233083 CI-3905 was opened, but this may not cover the whole needed corrections. Therefore CI-3905 was rejected an this CI was opened.

It need to be checked for 
- all companies and locations / all configurations
- for all types of receipts
- for statement total amount
that if the amount is negative, within the export no minus ("-") is allowed to be used. Instead of using "-" it is needed to handle those amounts as credits (instead of debits for positive amounts).
This is only about the export, of course within report the negative amounts still need to be shown with a minus ("-").

 

Attached find the one known example from CI-3905.

column291:
23/Oct/20 11:36 AM;nsanchez;+WE HAVE UPDATES FROM THE CLIENT:+

***quote***

Dear support team,

We just got the following message from our customer:

Dear support team!
Our payroll service provider informed us today in the course of its monthly upload of all employee data to the payroll account that the transferred files "payroll account" for September are incorrect. Enclosed you will find the consolidated payroll account file for September from our payroll accountant - please send it to i: FAO URGENTLY.
As far as can be seen, the following is incorrect:
- Diets (wage type 245) are shown as minus amounts
- Mileage allowance is shown under wage type 246, although it currently still has to be shown under wage type 249
(We have not yet given approval for the new calendar day calculation / project case 00184160, as this is still incorrect).

It seems that in the course of the tests for the calendar day calculation project at i: FAO, the settings for the payroll account file were also erroneously activated for the real clients!

As far as we can see, the "wrong" WAGE ACCOUNT files seem to have been generated since the test carried out by i: FAO on September 4th, 2020 - see our error message INC0247963 of September 7th, 2020 (test billing including export by Mr. or Ms. Nuria Bear ).
An exact error analysis can of course only be carried out by i: FAO itself - i: FAO can certainly understand all configuration changes and correct them immediately.

We ask you with i: FAO for URGENT clarification and rectification of the error as well as for rapid subsequent delivery of the correct files "salary account" for September. Please also send the correct wage account files for October to date, as these files also contain incorrect amounts and wage types.

Have you already switched the ongoing investigation or changes to the project live to all locations, although the project has not yet been completed? Please correct it urgently! Many Thanks! Kind regards,

 

+ORIGINAL:+

Liebes Support-Team,

uns hat gerade folgende Nachricht von unserem Kunden erreicht:

Liebes Support Team !
Unser Lohnverrechnungsdienstleister hat uns heute im Zuge seines monatlichen Uploads aller Mitarbeiterdaten aufs Lohnkonto informiert, dass die übertragenen Dateien "Lohnkonto" für September fehlerhaft sind. Anbei finden Sie die konsolidierte Lohnkonto-Datei September unseres Lohnverrechners - bitte um DRINGENDE Weiterleitung an i:FAO.
Soweit ersichtlich, ist folgendes fehlerhaft: 
- Diäten (Lohnart 245) werden als Minusbeträge ausgewiesen
- Kilometergeld wird unter der Lohnart 246 ausgewiesen, obwohl dies derzeit noch auf Lohnart 249 ausgewiesen werden muss 
(wir haben noch keine Freigabe für die neue Kalendertagberechnung / Projekt Case 00184160 erteilt, da diese bisher noch fehlerhaft ist).

Es scheint, als wären bei i:FAO im Zuge der Tests für das Projekt Kalendertagberechnung fälschlicherweise Einstellungen für die Lohnkonto-Datei auch bereits für die Echt-Mandanten aktiviert worden !

Soweit wir erkennen können, scheinen die "falschen" LOHNKONTO-Dateien generiert zu werden seit dem von i:FAO durchgeführten Test am 4.9.2020 - siehe dazu unsere Fehlermeldung INC0247963 vom 7.9.2020 (Testabrechnung inkl. Export von Hr. oder Frau Nuria Bear). 
Eine exakte Fehleranalyse kann aber natürlich nur von i:FAO selbst durchgeführt werden - i:FAO kann sicherlich alle Konfigurationsänderungen nachvollziehen und umgehend wieder korrigieren.

Wir ersuchen Sie mit i:FAO um DRINGENDE Klärung und Behebung des Fehlers sowie um rasche Nachlieferung der korrekten Dateien "Lohnkonto" für September. Bitte auch um Nachlieferung der korrekten Lohnkonto-Dateien für Oktober bis dato, da auch diese Dateien falsche Beträge und Lohnarten enthalten.

Habe Sie die laufende Untersuchung bzw. Änderungen des Projekts bereits auf allen Standorten live geschaltet, obwohl das Projekt noch nicht abgeschlossen ist? Bitte dringend um Korrektur! Vielen Dank!

****unquote****

{color:#de350b}*****please call the client directly{color}

 ;;;

column1: REDELECTRICA:Accommodation per diem is not allowed for last day of the trip
column26:
h2. +current situation+
 # ID *4056771* cannot be calculated because the mileage has changed from 1st Oct onwards: CI-3966
 # This Id has absences with mileage for : 29sep until 1oct.
 # Due to the split period of the mileage rate, the 1st oct absence was removed from the Id in order to be able to calculate it.
 # There is a validation in the system that does not allow you to have an accommodation in the last date of travel, but this user has to include it in the 30th of Sept
 # Enterprise: ama-es-GrupoRedElectrica / 2037825002 / 0 / ES / es_meals_rbt_03dietas / 20200501-20201001

h2. +consequence:+
 * If you end the trip on 30th Sep with accommodation you get error:{color:#de350b}Accommodation per diem is not allowed for last day of the trip{color}
 * If you extend the date to 1st Oct you get error: {color:#de350b}settings are not valid to this period{color}

So either way is not possible to finalize the ID.
h2. +target:+

The user must be able to calculate the Id regardless, as it is not on their side the configuration will not allow it, is there a way you can fix this issue?

 

(/)see attachments for visual explanation

thank you
column291: 16/Oct/20 1:48 PM;mstaszek;The only way I can think of is to change validation so it will not be triggered when the last day of trip is 30/09/2020. But than they would need to make sure manually if someone else didn't create expense statement with trip that end of this day with absence.;;;
column292:
16/Oct/20 2:37 PM;nsanchez;[~mstaszek] thank you for your comments!!

 

I had passed on to the client but Hector is still not convinced , is it definitely nothing can be done?

as the accommodation validation can not be reversed

 

thanks!;;;

Hello Team,

column292:
23/Oct/20 11:44 AM;nsanchez;hi Uwe we have received this new information from the client:

***quote***

Apparently we all talk past each other. Yes, written communication has its pitfalls.

Unfortunately, we still cannot understand the i: FAO statement.
What does the unspecified net amount have to do with the incorrectly reported total amount of VAT?

The calculations are correct - we fully agree with this statement.
But an incorrect total VAT amount appears on the PDF.

I: FAO may also charge 5% VAT in the background for the tip and add this amount (which does not appear anywhere) to the total VAT amount.

BUT: There is no VAT for tips.

The total amount of the tax is always correctly shown on the sheet "Details on the hospitality billing".

Explained again using the enclosed example (screenshot):

The total hospitality is EUR 144.70
a VAT rate of 5.00% applies for this, resulting in a VAT of EUR 6.89
A tip of EUR 5.30 was paid for this entertainment (which is VAT-free!)

An amount of EUR 150.00 (gross hospitality + tip) must be shown under the total and an amount of EUR 6.89 under VAT

The responsible i: FAO employee is welcome to contact us by phone.

The fact is that - in the case of a tax audit - we cannot explain to the tax authorities why a total amount for VAT is listed on the PDF cost statement that does not match the data in our accounting and is also incomprehensible (because it is incorrect).

We look forward to an explanation from i: FAO.

Thank you for your support.

Best Regards
Waltraud Barna

Please let us know in case you would like to clarify this with the client directly.

 

original:

 

cheinbar reden wir alle aneinander vorbei. Ja die schriftliche Kommunikation hat so ihre Tücken.

Leider können wir die Erklärung von i:FAO noch immer nicht nachvollziehen.
Was hat der nicht angeführte Nettobetrag mit dem falsch ausgewiesenen Gesamtbetrag der USt zu tun ?

Die Berechnungen stimmen ja - dieser Aussage stimmen wir ja voll zu.
Aber auf dem PDF erscheint ein falsche Gesamtbetrag bei der USt.

Möglicherweise berechnet i:FAO im Hintergrund für das Trinkgeld auch 5 % USt. und zählt diesen Betrag (der nirgends aufscheint) zum Gesamtbetrag der USt dazu.

ABER: Für Trinkgeld gibt es keine USt.

Am Blatt "Details zur Bewirtungskostenabrechnung" ist der Gesamtbetrag der Steuer ja immer korrekt ausgewiesen.

Noch einmal erklärt anhand beiliegenden Beispiels (Screenshot):

Die Summe Bewirtung beträgt EUR 144,70
dafür gilt ein USt Satz von 5,00 % und ergibt dies eine USt von EUR 6,89
Bei dieser Bewirtung wurde auch ein Trinkgeld von EUR 5,30 bezahlt (welches USt-frei ist !)

Auszuweisen unter Gesamtsumme sind somit ein Betrag von EUR 150,00 (Bewirtung brutto + Trinkgeld) und unter USt. ein Betrag von EUR 6,89

Gerne kann uns die/der zuständige Mitarbeiter/-in von i:FAO telefonisch kontaktieren.

Fakt ist, dass wir - im Falle einer Steuerprüfung - den Finanzbehörden nicht erklären können, warum auf der PDF Kostenabrechnung ein Gesamtbetrag für die USt angeführt wird, der nicht mit den Daten in unserer Buchhaltung übereinstimmt und auch nicht nachvollziehbar ist (weil falsch).

Gerne erwarten wir eine Erklärung von i:FAO.

Danke für Ihre Unterstützung.

***unquote***

please kindly let me know, i think they have a point here...

thanks!;;;

column1: Universal: reduced tax rates only for location Universal-Investment-Labs GmbH
column26:
With CI-3643 the reduced tax rates had been implemented. Now it turned out that the reduced tax rates are only allowed to be available in location Universal-Investment-Labs GmbH

At the moment the location Universal-Investment-Labs GmbH is using the vegas standard config of the system. Therefore it is needed to create a subfolder in vegas config for Universal-Investment-Labs GmbH.

The vegas config for Universal-Investment-Labs GmbH then needs to have reduced tax rates available and in addition the reduced tax rates needs to be removed from the vegas standard config file.

The current setup in engine part to use V4 for 0500 and V3 for 1600 should remain. If it is needed to make adaptions here based on the new subfolder in vegas for location Universal-Investment-Labs GmbH, then please do so.

Finally summarized: the new tax rates should only be selectable if the user is related to location Universal-Investment-Labs GmbH. if the user is located to any other location, the reduced tax rates should not be selectable. In report and export for the reduced tax rates the tax keys V3 and V4 needs to be used.

column1: ÖBB - bug in calculation logic
column26:
The issue could be reproduced in statement 5087625 (attached).

*Current situation:*

The calculation for statement 4920632 (attached) and 5087625 is not as expected. Currently the per diems and meal deductions are calculated as follows:

2* 31,00€ (customized per diems foreign country) = 62,00 €

2*4,65 (meal deduction foreign country) = 9,30€
 * 62,00€ - 9,30€ = 52,70€

This wrong calculation also leads into wrong taxation of 860Q. There should not be any taxation calculated for 860Q, because it is not above the limit.

 

*Expected calculation:* (ÖBB is calculating on basis of hours, not a days)

Absence: 30.06. 9pm – 02.07. 10.15pm -> 50h -> 26/12

26/12 (Total reimbursement- is calculated on twelfth basis(domestic))

3/3 + 3/3 = 24/12 (Foreign country part – is calculated on third basis)
 * 26/12 – 24/12 = 2/12 (domestic part)
 * 1/12 = 26,40€ / 12 = 2,20€
 * 62,00€ - 9,30€ = 52,70€ + 4,40€ (2*2,2) = 57,10€ (correct calculation)

For 860Q nothing should be calculated as the limit is calculated like this:

2 * 35,80€ (legal per diems) + 2 * 2,20€ = 76,00€

The total amount of 57,10€ does not reach the limit, hence no taxation needs to be calculated for 860Q.

 

Please check the calculation logic regarding domestic and foreign calculation.

The general calculation is based on the total amount, calculated on the domestic rules:

Total amount in twelfth (domestic) – foreign (calculated in third) = domestic part (in twelfth)
column75: 14/Dec/20 9:30 AM;marscholl;AW_ Benötigte Rückmeldungen zu CI-3665 _ CI-3667 _ CI-3911 _Zusatz_ HRDM 855- Berechnungsgrundlagen .msg;https://jira.ifao.net/secure/attachment/96950/AW_+Ben%C3%B6tigte+R%C3%BCckmeldungen+zu+CI-3665+_+CI-3667+_+CI-3911+_Zusatz_+HRDM+855-+Berechnungsgrundlagen+.msg
column291: 11/Sep/20 10:27 AM;kuhnc;If you have any question to this calculation, please let me know. ;;;
column292:
08/Oct/20 8:05 AM;kuhnc;Hi [~lanfermann],

I asked for customer explanation and now I understood more the calculation within this ticket and within the examples during implementation.

the domestic per diems are only added, if the absence is more then three hours. If it is less, the domestic part art dropped. Example:

05.04. 07:00-08:00 Uhr AT

05.04. 08:00-15:00 Uhr DE

05.04. 15:00-16:00 Uhr AT

 

total: 05.04. 07:00 – 05.04. 16:00 -> 9 h -> 9/12

foreign country: 05.04. 08:00 – 05.04. 15:00 -> 7 h  -> 2/3 -> 8/12

=> domestic: 09/12 – 08/12 = 01/12

 

foreign: 2/3 -> 30,7€*0,66= 20,26€

domestic: 1/12 -> 2,2€ {color:#FF0000}(are dropped, because the absence is only two hours){color}
 * Auszahlung: 20,26€

 

In the attached mail you can find further details (German).;;;
column293: 30/Oct/20 11:25 AM;lanfermann;Reviewed with Doreen and Marius, calculation seems to be fine. Waiting for feedback from ÖBB;;;
column294:
14/Dec/20 9:30 AM;marscholl;Got the following feedback from ÖBB (complete E-Mail attached):
 * CI 3911/ HRDRM 1170:

     

Werbungskosten und ESTG: Berechnung korrekt!

 

Erklärung > Arbeitsrechtlicher Anspruch:

Ausschnitt aus der BV:

 
 #  *Gesamtanspruch*

|*Datum von*|*Uhrzeit von*|*Datum bis*|*Uhrzeit bis*|*Std. / Min.*|*Anspruch*|
|30.06.XXXX|21:00|01.07.XXXX|21:00|24 h|12/12|
|01.07.XXXX|21:00|02.07.XXXX|21:00|24 h|12/12|
|02.07.XXXX|21:00|02.07.XXXX|22:15|1 h 15 Min|0/12|
| | | | | |*24/12*|
 #  *Auslandsteil (Italien)*

|*Datum von*|*Uhrzeit von*|*Datum bis*|*Uhrzeit bis*|*Std. / Min.*|*Anspruch*|
|30.06.XXXX|21:27|01.07.XXXX|21:27|24 h|3/3|
|01.07.XXXX|21:27|02.07.XXXX|13:01|15h 34 Min|3/3|
| | | | | |6/3 = 24*/12*|

*III. Inlandsteil (Österreich)*

Inlandsteil = Gesamtanspruch minus Auslandsteil

24/12 – 24/12 = *0/12*
 #  *Ergebnis:*

| ** |*Land*|*Volles Taggeld*|*Anzahl* |*Höhe in €*|
|Auslandsteil|IT|2 x 31,00
 - 31,00 x 15% *)
 - 31,00 x 15% *)|6/3|62,00
 - 4,65
 - 4,65|
|Inlandsteil|AT|26,40|0/12|00,00|
| | | | |*+52,70+*|

 

*) Kürzung des Taggelds für kostenlos zur Verfügung gestelltes Frühstück

 

 
 * NEU: Wichtige Ergänzung für die Nummer HRDRM 855 (Mahlzeitkürzung im Ausland)

 

Erklärung > Arbeitsrechtlicher Anspruch:

 

 

Nach der Betriebsvereinbarung über den Aufwandsersatz bei Dienstreisen ist das gebührende Taggeld
 # a)           für das Frühstück um 15%,
 # b)          für das Mittagessen um 42,5%,
 # c)           für das Abendessen um 42,5%

des *vollen* Taggeldes zu kürzen, wenn die Verpflegung des Arbeitnehmers durch den Arbeitgeber unentgeltlich beigestellt wird oder die Verpflegung in anderen vom Arbeitgeber zu ersetzenden Aufwendungen bereits enthalten ist.

 

Diese Kürzung ist beim gebührenden Taggeld für das Ausland bzw. wenn für Dienstreisen von höchstens 5 Stunden Dauer sowie für Stundenreste bis zu 5 Stunden bei mehrtägigen Dienstreisen *statt dem Auslandstaggeld* *das* *Inlandstaggeld* gebührt, bei diesem vorzunehmen.

Da im konkreten Beispiel ein Mittagessen in einem Zeitraum mit Anspruch auf Inlandstaggeld zur Verfügung gestellt wurde, ergibt sich somit folgender Anspruch:
 #  *Gesamtanspruch*

|*Datum von*|*Uhrzeit von*|*Datum bis*|*Uhrzeit bis*|*Std. / Min.*|*Anspruch*|
|02.03.2020|08:00|03.03.2020|08:00|24 h|12/12|
|03.03.2020|08:00|03.03.2020|13:41|5 h 41 Min|6/12|
| | | | | |*18/12*|
 #  *Auslandsteil*

column1: EGIS - Claiming Meal Expenses
column26:
Hello team,

 

Following the CI-3626 (June), customer back to us because he will want to make some changes.

 

The customer wants the system to work this way:

Blocking error:
- Perdiem lunch meal + BT31 (Because two lunch meals declared)
- Perdiem meal evening + BT32 (Because two meals evening declared)
- Perdiem lunch + BT32 + BT34 (For three declared meals)
- Perdiem meal evening + BT31 + BT34 (For three declared meals)
- Perdiem meal noon + evening + BT34 (For three declared meals)
- BT31 + BT32 + BT34 (For three declared meals)

No error in case of accumulation on these cases:
- Perdiem midday + (BT32 or BT34)
- Perdiem evening + (BT31 or BT34)
- Whatever the BT50 or BT30 declarations


Receipt types BT30 and BT50 being out of any rules such as this one => the breakfast not being concerned by the perdiems and the invitations being able to be carried out at the time of a breakfast, a snack, an event, etc

 

Thank you to bring the modifications requested by the customer.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: TUI - Taxation issue (TBS Trainee, meals taxation, wage type 6021)
column26:
Hello team,

 

Please could you investigate this case ?

 

TUI asked us help to understand how is calcutated the taxation for the wage type 6021.

 

Example statement 3228633

 

<PostingRecord>

<AccountNumber>6021</AccountNumber>

<CostUnit></CostUnit>

<CostCenter></CostCenter>

<Amount>98.00</Amount>

<NetAmount>0.00</NetAmount>

<TaxRate>0.00</TaxRate>

<TaxAmount>0.00</TaxAmount>

<TaxRateKey></TaxRateKey>

<PostingKey></PostingKey>

<PostingRecordType>WAGE</PostingRecordType>

<PostingText>Mahlzeiten pro Tag zusätzlicher Betrag</PostingText>

<ElementID>3228633</ElementID>

</PostingRecord>

<PostingRecord>

 

After some investigation and asking to Samuel Jeglot help us to explain this to customer, He noticed that there was a bug in the export file related to the calculation of headings, only for the Trainee configuration in TUI Business Services.

 

In his email Samuel also put this :

Wage type amount 9320 – “Steuerfreie Verpflegungspauschale” (9320) is not properly calculated.

Also the wage type “Mahlzeiten pro Tag zusätzlicher Betrag” (6021) should not be displayed, it doesn’t make sense.

 

Please let me know if you need more information to investigate properly.

 

TUI has another statement in the same case, I asked them to provide us with the numbers. I will let you know as soon as I receive them.

 

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sandra
column264: Trainee configuration in TUI Business Services
column292:
14/Sep/20 5:13 PM;ssanz;Hello [~salajan],

You will find below, additional information for consistency in heading 6021 for ALL the different PostingTexts. Informations sent today by TUI :

"Dear all, we need consistence in wage type 6021 for ALL different PostingTexts.
*************** Information from AMA by e-mail*******************************
After some investigations, you are right there are some inconsistencies on wage types.
Taking into account your constraint that no calculation is done on your side, here what can be done for the different wages:
• 6021
o Lohnversteuerung Verpflegungspauschalen / 3-months rule
For this wage, <Amount> = taxable amount
o Lohnversteuerung Mahlzeiten / Received meals when no perdiem (ie. Trip <8hours and meal deductions)
For this wage, <Amount> = taxable amount
o TUI Retail – Seminarpauschale / TUI Retail - Seminar Allowance
For this wage, <Amount> = taxable amount
o Lohnversteuerung Verpflegungsmehraufwand / Internal business meal
For this wage, <NetAmount> = taxable amount
o Mahlzeiten pro Tag zusätzlicher Betrag
There is an issue on going related to this wage, it doesn’t make sense. It is only for Business Services company and only for Trainees. So don’t take this one into account, it will be removed soon.
• 9325 “M-flag” : it is just an indicator, the amount fields are not used.
• 9320 “Steuerfreie Verpflegungspauschale” = Tax-free meal allowance value and <Amount> = <NetAmount>. It was a specific request from TUI to provide it in the export file.

So 6021 “Lohnversteuerung Verpflegungsmehraufwand” is not consistent with the others. We can modify to align it with the others. Is it OK with you?
What is the rule on your side? Do you take always <Amount> for all the 6021 wages?
******************************************************************************
Yes, we always take <Amount> for all 6021 wages, so please align, to have the taxable amount in <Amount> and the total amount in <NetAmount>. When will this be ready?"

 

I hope all that can help you.

Best regards,

Sandra;;;

28/Aug/20 8:22 AM;nsanchez;hi please take into account clients comments about the issue reported:

****quote****

Liebes Support Team, liebe Frau Burgstaller !Liebes Support Team, liebe Frau Burgstaller !
Nachstehend finden Sie die gewünschten Informationen zur Anfrage von i:FAO:
ad 1) korrektes Lohnkonto für KM GeldBei der Zuweisung zur korrekten Lohnart ist zu unterscheiden zwischen „lohnsteuerpflichtigem“ und „lohnsteuerfreiem“ KM-Geld:- lohnsteuerpflichtiges (= einkommenssteuerpflichtiges) KM Geld muss der Lohnart 246 zugewiesen werden o dies betrifft die übermittelten Beispiele und Anmerkungen für die Kostenabrechnung ID 5034122 + ID 5017086
- lohnsteuerfreies KM (= einkommenssteuerfreies) Geld muss der Lohnart 249 zugewiesen werdeno siehe betrifft die übermittelten Beispiele und Anmerkungen für die Kostenabrechnung ID 5034109 + ID 5034089
- zur Info - anbei auch ein Screenshot der Anforderung für „steuerliche Behandlung von KM-Geld und Parkgebühren“ für diesen Auftrag vom Jänner 2018 (!!)
- die von i:FAO angeführte Erklärung / „Antwort zu Frage 1“ können wir so nicht nachvollziehenunserer Meinung nach hat die Zuweisung auf die Lohnart (246 oder 249) nichts mit der Höhe des KM Geldes zu tun!

ad 2) Mahlzeitenabzüge am LohnkontoJa das stimmt: In der Exportdatei Lohnkonto sind die Mahlzeiten (Abzüge) derzeit noch nicht korrekt berücksichtigt / abgezogen.Siehe dazu die übermittelten Beispiele und Anmerkungen für die Kostenabrechnung ID 5034109 + ID 5034089 + ID 5017086

 

****unquote***

 

Dear Support Team, dear Mrs Burgstaller !

Below you will find the requested information regarding i:FAO's request:

ad 1) correct salary account for KM money
When assigning to the correct wage type, {color:#de350b}a distinction must be made between "wage tax-liable" and "wage tax-free" KM mone{color}y:
- KM money subject to wage tax (= income tax liable) must be assigned to wage type 246 
o this concerns the examples and remarks submitted for the cost accounting ID 5034122 + ID 5017086

- wage tax-free KM (= income tax-free) money must be assigned to wage type 249
o See the examples and remarks provided for the cost accounting ID 5034109 + ID 5034089

- for your information - enclosed also a screenshot of the requirement for "tax treatment of KM-money and parking fees" for this order from January 2018 (!!)

- the explanation / "answer to question 1" given by i:FAO cannot be understood in this way
In our opinion, the assignment to the wage type (246 or 249) has nothing to do with the amount of KM money!


ad 2) Meal deductions on the payroll account
Yes, that's right: In the payroll account export file, the meals (deductions) are currently not yet correctly included / deducted.
See the examples and notes for the payroll accounting ID 5034109 + ID 5034089 + ID 5017086


Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

 ;;;

column1: ama-de-tui: special characters and ae, oe, ue in XML-structure
column293:
01/Sep/20 10:12 AM;salajan;Thanks [~nsanchez]

In the export that you attached, the German Umlauts are correct:  !image-2020-09-01-09-13-00-459.png!

 

So, there is nothing to do for German characters.

 

The only "problem" here is "#x2F" which is actually the character "/" encoded. This is because the export is XML, a / in the middle would break the grammar of the XML file. So all XML specific characters are encoded as follows: 
 "&" : "amp"
 "<" : "lt"
 ">" : "gt"
 '"' : 'quot'
 "'" : '#39'
 "/" : '#x2F'

Hope this clarifies.;;;

column1: Rheinmetall - wrong tax key reported and exported for VIP
column26:
Rheinmetall AG and configuration for VIP:

For tax 16% the tax key V5 will be exported. V5 is the tax key for 16% for RWM (Rheinmetall Waffe und Munition) only, Rheinmetall AG is using V2.
This was configured with CI-3689

Please check config for VIP for Rheinmetall AG and Rheinmetall Immobililen to ensure that tax key V2 is used for 16% and V4 is used for 5%.

Please ensure that for RWM (Rheinmetall Waffe und Munition) the tax keys V5 for 16% and V4 for 5% remain untouched.

column291:
11/Aug/20 10:45 AM;lanfermann;Hi [~ngraf], for Rheinmetall we have _three_ different configurations:

# RWM: 16% > V5
# Rheinmetall AG (includes also Immobilien GmbH and their test locations): 16% > V2
# Rheinmetall (includes Rheinmetall AG BCD and VIP): 16% > V5

Since some locations are doubled in the last config, I assume that this config is wrong in general. So, if you can confirm that VIP and BCD should have 5% > V4 and 16% > V2 in place, I will correct these configs ;;;

column1: msg - report is adding non-entertainment receipts into list of entertainment receipts
column26:
We had not been able to reproduce this, but customer has several examples where the report (and the export) does contain receipts that are not related to entertainment in the listing for entertainment. 

Please check if this might be related to changes done with CI-3569. CI-3508 or CI-2864-

Known problems in statements:
 * statement 9368093
into receipt with ID 9368133 of kind parking fee, there was somehow also a tip added
this tip has the same amount like the tip in receipt 9368138, which is one of the two the real entertainment receipts of this statement
--> finally this caused that for the parking fee including a tip of 7,50 EUR the receipt was handled falsely as entertainment
 * statement 9386910
receipt with ID 9386957 which is of type hotel is finally added to the entertainment list in the report
 * statement 9387110
receipt with ID 9387135 is of type hotel and does contain falsely a tip with same amount of the tip of receipt 9387137
finally receipt 9387135 is falsely listed within the list of entertainments

column277: Change request to an existing configuration (Repository)
column291:
10/Aug/20 4:56 PM;nopre;PDF does not display employee location when it is empty in Expense FdF. Actually the FdF value was not transferred from user profile to Expense FdF. There was an issue on the FdF code used in Expense compared to the one set in TMS. Did the change today 10AUG, and requested the load to production. Only production system is impacted: TMS FdF code "employee Location", whereas expense configuration file was using "employee_Location" (with an underscore). Just removed the underscore to align with TMS code. Only new Expense Statements created after the fix is loaded will get the employee location correctly fulfill from user profile, and then displayed in the PDF.

Brgds/Joel.;;;
column292: 11/Aug/20 2:31 PM;nopre;It's fixed and uploaded to production. Create a new Expense Statement to verify issue is solved.;;;

column1: Error in the export file after VAT change
column26:
Hello team,

After DE tax rate keys change, on STAGING system there is not any problem but on PRODUCTION, the customer reported us that the export file is failing because the information is wrong.

In the export file line 6 and 7 are correct as they are from June, line 3 and 5 are the lines for the new tax codes and should have instead of 471700471700115500020000 the corresponding accounts.  it should be 1575001575000155...  (with the new information for 16%) and 1570501570501155... (for 5%). We had the same problem when we tested on BALI in the past and it is in our teams chat. It only happens on PROD because on BALI and STAGING after our tests was correct.

 

Thank you team!! Best regards,

Alejandro

column1: Rheinmetall - rounding problem causes diffreneces of 1 cent
column26:
Related to all locations of RWM where splitting costs onto different cost centers  is possible:

In few cases the 100% amount is not identical to the sum of all parts. Although the difference might only be 1 cent, this will cause a problem in the following SAP system of the customer.

Therefore it is needed to validate that the sum of all split parts in the export is identical to the original amount of the receipt.

If the total amount cannot be divided as needed and a cent is mismatching, then the first segment in the export of both should be 1 cent higher than the second export.


Explained on one of the newest examples happened:

Statement 4918158 - export file attached
location: RWM DE - Niederlassung Buck Fronau
Splitting cost center 1 and cost center 2: 50/50
Fueling: 51,99 EUR -> 43,69 EUR net + 8,30 EUR vat
Export: 
- cost center 1: 21,85 EUR 
- cost center 2: 21,85 EUR
--> sum: 43,70 EUR which is 1 cent more than the expected total of 43,69 EUR
expectation from the customer:
- cost center 1: 21,85 EUR
- cost center 2: 21,84 EUR
- total sum: 43,69 EUR

column1: EnBW - vegas configuration update for new MwSt and receipts
column26:
Please change in 
vegas/cE-configs/configurations/travel/EnBW/configuration2020_01_01.xml
the types of receipts for DE from existing one to the attached ones.

This is needed as the new types of tax (either 5% or 16%) should only be available depending on the original types of tax.
i.e. if a receipt related to country DE does contain 
- tax rate regular, then the new tax rate 16% needs to be added
- tax rate reduced, then the new tax rate 5% needs to be added
- tax rates regular and reduced, then the ne tax rates 16% and 5% need to be added.

With CI-3643 it was implemented to add both new tax rates 5% and 16% to all DE receipts, therefore it is needed to reduce this as explained above. See also attachment, where the not wanted tax rates had already been removed.

column1: Endress+Hauser - VAT for Business Entertainment is not correctly calculated
column26:
We received incident the VAT for Business Entertainment is not correctly calculated

I checked config and engine but it seems to be set correctly.

 

Other than Business Entertainment was calculated without any problems, and the tax is also displayed in the posting record.

       <postingRecord>

          <description>Business entertainment</description>

          <accountNumber>BEWFR</accountNumber>

          <amount>105.8</amount>

          <netAmount>105.8</netAmount>

          <taxAmount>0.0</taxAmount>

          <taxRateKey>T1</taxRateKey>

          <postingKey>40</postingKey>

          <postingRecordType>DEBIT</postingRecordType>

          <elementID>3631410</elementID>

          <allowNegativeWageAmounts>false</allowNegativeWageAmounts>

        </postingRecord>

 

 The expectation is following posting record

        <postingRecord>

          <description>Business entertainment</description>

          <accountNumber>BEWFR</accountNumber>

          <amount>105.8</amount>

          <netAmount>89.83</netAmount>

          <taxAmount>15.97</taxAmount>

          <taxRateKey>T1</taxRateKey>

          <postingKey>40</postingKey>

          <postingRecordType>DEBIT</postingRecordType>

          <elementID>3631410</elementID>

          <allowNegativeWageAmounts>false</allowNegativeWageAmounts>

        </postingRecord>

 

 

I created the EXPENG-199 on this issue.

Marius Hilbich mention me “There is no cost type defined for tips on that system, therefore it is assumed that the tip is reimbursed with the entertainments amount and cost type. Tips aren't taxed which leads to the whole entertainments tax amount to be set to zero.” “You should either add a cost type for tips or don't allow taxes for entertainments.”

 

The cost type for tip needs to be added in engine and not vegas. eg:

new CostTypeHelper(ConfigurationSet.KEY_ENTERTAINMENT_TIP, "Bewirtung Trinkgeld", "4650", null, "", "")

Not allowing taxes for entertainments would be accomplished if you only allow the selection of "expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.none" for entertainments in vegas.

 

 Could you please add the cost types and check the behavior before we propose something to the customer?

 

Best regards,

Yutaka

column1: Rheinmetall - Export problem
column26:
For some cases in the export file "MWSKZ" is set to "**".

This is caused by 

[cE-configs|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/ce-configs/browse]/[configurations|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/ce-configs/browse/configurations]/[mega|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/ce-configs/browse/configurations/mega]/[rheinmetall|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/ce-configs/browse/configurations/mega/rheinmetall]/[RWM DE Teststandort|https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/VEG/repos/ce-configs/browse/configurations/mega/rheinmetall/RWM%20DE%20Teststandort]/configuration2018_01_01.xml 
... FDF code="line"...
writeElement("BSCHL",g.postingKey,c+2,2);
if(g.postingKey=="27"||g.postingKey=="37"||g.postingKey=="23"||g.postingKey=="33")\{writeElement("KOART","K",c+2,0)}else\{writeElement("KOART","S",c+2,0)}
if(g.postingKey=="27"||g.postingKey=="23"||g.postingKey=="40")\{writeElement("SHKZG","S",c+2,0)}else\{writeElement("SHKZG","H",c+2,0)}writeElement("GSBER","",c+2,0);writeElement("PARGB","",c+2,0);
if(g.postingKey=="27"||g.postingKey=="37"||g.postingKey=="23"||g.postingKey=="33")\{writeElement("MWSKZ","**",c+2,2)}else\{if(g.accountNumber!="191026"){writeElement("MWSKZ",g.taxRateKey,c+2,2)}else\{writeElement("MWSKZ","",c+2,2)}}
...


As it can seen in the screenshot attached:
MWSKZ = **
BSCHL = 33
This means g.postingKey was set to 33 before.
The related statement 4920981 contains hotel receipt and hotel breakfast receipt. 

It was expected that the taxRateKey would have been exported to MWSKZ.

May it be that there is a hard coded configuration in Ui that is setting g.postingKey to 33.
Please let me know whether this is as design and how it came that the postingKey is 33.
Please check if this is related to new tax keys V2, V4 and V5 or if this is related to specific kind of receipts only.

Thanks!
column291:
09/Jul/20 10:16 PM;tuemce;[~ngraf]:

First of all, please don't use minified code as example. The whole code can be found in exportLineProd.js. 

The current logic is that for posting records with the posting keys 33,28,38,23 MWSKZ will be set to "**"

for all other keys (except for account no. 191026) MWSKZ will be filled with the current taxRateKey

Did I understand this correctly that the expectation is that also for posting key "33" the taxRateKex is expected in MWSKZ ?;;;
column292:
10/Jul/20 2:49 PM;ngraf;No, I need to know first why posing key was set to 33.
Customer is expecting a taxRateKey in MWSK instead of **

As I cannot see from the config and fro the statment, why posting key was set to 33, I don't know yet if this problem is caused by the customer using wrong data or caused by the config.

PS: my information about the code found is related to Rheinmetall on Travel where no exportLineProd.js can be found.

BR
Nicole;;;
column293:
13/Jul/20 3:46 PM;ngraf;Explanation sent to Mr. Maas as as design and wrong handling by the customer:

 

Sehr geehrter Herr Maas,

nun habe ich Schulung von unserer Entwicklung zum Thema bekommen: das vorliegende "Problem" des Exports von "**", hervorgerufen durch Buchungsschlüssel "33" ist kein Fehler, sondern as design und seit mindestens einem Jahr, vermutlich länger, so in Ihrem System für die Standorte RWM implementiert.

Die Stelle, an der im zugrundeliegenden Export ** zu finden ist, basiert auf der Art der Reisekostenabrechnung (hier Buschungschlüssel 33 = Erstattung).
Wenn man sich den Export jedoch detaillierter ansieht und die Exportdaten für die Belege der Reisekostenabrechnung prüft, werden hier V5 für das Frühstück mit 10,34 EUR und V4 für die Übernachtung mit 142,86 EUR exportiert.
Da auf Ihrem Screenshot der Betrag von 162,00 EUR ausgewiesen ist, handlet es sich hierbei um den Gesamtbertrag der RKA und deshalb wie zu erwarten **
Dass für die RKA ** abgezeigt wird, ist auch nachvollziehbar, da in der RKA ja unterschiedliche MWSKZ abhängig von den Belegen zum Zuge kommen und die Anzeige eines Steuerkennzeichens nicht korrekt sein kann.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen
Nicole Graf;;;

column1: Fiege - Change Conditional Workflow to skip Audit but to not skip Approval
column26:
With CI-3423 it was implement to skip audit and to skip approval for specific conditions.

It turned out, that skipping the approval was not wanted by the customer. This was caused by a translation and understanding failure of mine, when creating CI-3423.

Please remove the skipping of the approval flow for the following conditions. Only skip of Audit should remain in the code.

No auditing is required if exactly one of the following conditions does match, approval should not be skipped:
 * Condition 1: The trip does only contain absences and no receipts. 
 * Condition 2: The trip is only about mileages allowances. 
 * Condition 3: The trip does only contain absences and mileage allowances. 
 * Condition 4: IF all receipts are Paid-by-Company AND no absences available, THEN skip approval and audit

column1: BerlinHyp - Change type for the FDF "Reiseart"
column26:
Hello Team,Hello Team,


Due to CE-2770, there was defiened that the error message "Sorry, your expense statement could not be retrieved" is due to the problem comes that in the config, the type in the FDF "reiseart" is "List"  when below the booking is defined with "from.fixed.list" 


Please could you corrected the type "List" into "LargeList"  in the FDF "Reiseart" ? 

cE-configs/configurations/mega/bcdtravel-de-berlinhyp/configuration2020_01_01.xml

 

<dataFieldDescriptor code="Reiseart" tmsCode="Reiseart" mandatory="true" type={color:#de350b}"List"{color} feature="${CYTRIC_EXPENSE_BUSINESS_CODE}" elementLinkType="net.ifao.vegas.domain.expense.StringLink" elementLinkRole="expense.configurationKey">
 <assignTo>
 <assign type="${CLASS_ExpenseStatement}" displayOrder="3">
 <validation>
 <from.booking>
 <constraint>
 <{color:#de350b}from.fixed.list{color} />
 </constraint>
 </from.booking>
 </validation>
 <gui>
 <dataFieldGUI guiType="LIST" tab="ExpenseStatement.genData" />
 </gui>
 </assign>
 </assignTo>

 

FYI, in the configuration before cE-configs/configurations/mega/bcdtravel-de-berlinhyp/configuration2016_01_01.xml, the type was in LargeList


Thank you for your help.

Best regards, Sandra

<entry key="postingRecordGeneration.ExpenseData.4.scriptContent"><entry key="postingRecordGeneration.ExpenseData.4.scriptContent"> <![CDATA[   importClass(java.util.List); new ArrayList();   }      if (expense.getAbsences() != null)\{     var absIter = expense.getAbsences().listIterator();     while(absIter.hasNext()){       var abs = absIter.next();       if (abs.getMeals() != null){          var mealIter = abs.getMeals().listIterator();          while(mealIter.hasNext()){            var meal = mealIter.next();            if (meal.getTypeOfMeal().getKey().equals("expense.absence.meal.breakfast") ||                meal.getTypeOfMeal().getKey().equals("expense.absence.meal.lunch") ||                meal.getTypeOfMeal().getKey().equals("expense.absence.meal.dinner")){                  log.fine("Meal found, setting Kennzeichen M");                  expense.putLink(new StringLink("expense.receipt.flagM", "true"));                  isMealFound = true;            }          }        }     }   }    if (isMealFound)\{     log.fine("Writing Wage Posting Record for Kennzeichen M");     var wagePostingRecord = new WagePostingRecord();     wagePostingRecord.accountNumber = "KZCHM";     wagePostingRecord.description = "Kennzeichen M";     wagePostingRecord.amount = 1.0;     wagePostingRecord.netAmount = 1.0;     wagePostingRecord.taxRate = 0.0;     wagePostingRecord.taxAmount = 0.0;     wagePostingRecord.elementID = element.unid;          postingRecords.add(wagePostingRecord);   }      var statPerDiemsSumLink = expense.getLink(LinkRoles.TRAVEL_STATUTORY_SUBSISTENCE_PER_DIEMS_SUM);   var statMelDeductionLink = expense.getLink(LinkRoles.MEAL_STATUTORY_DEDUCTION_SUM);      if(statPerDiemsSumLink && statPerDiemsSumLink.getValue() && statPerDiemsSumLink.getValue().getAmount() > 0) \{     log.fine("Writing Wage Posting Record for tax free per diems");     var statPerDiemsSum = statPerDiemsSumLink.getValue().getAmount();     var taxRelevantPerDiems = 0;     if(statMelDeductionLink && statMelDeductionLink.getValue()) {       statMealDeductions = statMelDeductionLink.getValue().getAmount();     }          var taxFreePerDiems = statPerDiemsSum - statMealDeductions;          var wagePostingRecord = new WagePostingRecord();     wagePostingRecord.accountNumber = "SFVMA";     wagePostingRecord.description = "Steuerfreie Verpflegungspauschale";     wagePostingRecord.amount = taxFreePerDiems;     wagePostingRecord.netAmount = taxFreePerDiems;     wagePostingRecord.taxRate = 0.0;     wagePostingRecord.taxAmount = 0.0;     wagePostingRecord.elementID = element.unid;            postingRecords.add(wagePostingRecord);   }      element.setPostingRecords(postingRecords); ]]>  </entry>

column300:
21/Jul/20 11:47 AM;nsanchez;[~tuemce]

comments of client testing:

unfortunately, the settlement is again on a mistake, now on another one. Enclosed the info from Conovum:

There are two reasons for this: 
- The income tax code is noted both as DEBIT and as WAGE, but this is only a purely technical value that should not lead to payment. 
- The items of the meals per diems look completely different than in the old setup.

I once attached their incorrect example 147668 and a correct example 139180. Can you ask your colleague Nuria to have the error technically tested again on our site and Allianz site only when the XML looks technically and professionally like in our old setup? Anything else would be a deviation from the previous standard and would automatically lead to errors. I think this way the error could be fixed a bit faster.


original:

leider läuft die Abrechnung wieder auf einen Fehler, nun auf einen anderen.  Anbei die Info von Conovum:leider läuft die Abrechnung wieder auf einen Fehler, nun auf einen anderen.  Anbei die Info von Conovum:
Hierfür gibt es zwei Gründe: • Das Lohnsteuerkennzeichen ist sowohl als DEBIT als auch als WAGE vermerkt, es handelt sich hierbei jedoch nur um einen rein fachlichen Wert, der nicht zur Auszahlung führen soll. • Die Positionen der Verpflegungspauschalen sehen völlig anders aus, als bei dem alten Setup.
Ich habe einmal ihr fehlerhaftes Beispiel 147668 und ein korrektes Beispiel 139180 angehängt. Können Sie die Kollegin Nuria bitten, den Fehler erst dann wieder technisch auf unserer Seite und Allianz Seite testen zu lassen, wenn das XML technisch und fachlich aussieht wie in unserem alten Setup? Alles andere wäre eine Abweichung des bisherigen Standards und würde somit automatisch auf Fehler laufen. Ich denke so könnte der Fehler etwas schneller ausgebessert werden. 
Bei Fragen gerne auf Frau Mauerberger von Conovum zugehen. 

*******************

 

see attached files

column1: EGIS - problem display with the "Vehicle type" box in the Daily route
column26:
Hello Team,

Egis asks me about a display problem with the "Vehicle type" combobox in the "Daily route" form.
This field displays the default value of the field once the expense report is completed.
Explanation with Statement 3511816 :

- Editing statement with a trip, Vehicle type: 7Cv and more
- Submitted statement: It's always displayed 7Cv and more
- Audited statement: It's always displayed 7Cv and more
- statement validated : It's still displaying 7Cv and more
- statement counted: It is always displayed 7Cv and more
- statement Terminated: Displayed 3Cv
Beside this, the PDF export shows the value 7Cv and more and the calculation looks good.

Other statements in example : 3486906, 3513476

Would it be possible to correct this because they have questions from their users ?
Thanks for your help.
Best regards,
Sandra

column1: EGIS - Duplicate meals no longer distinguished in statement
column26:
Hello Team,

Please could you check why the system no longer distinguished the costs of potentially duplicate meals (same date, same meal)

Example from expense report 3547027 where the user defined two meals via "Days itinerary" on 03/14/2020 and two meals via "Receipts" on 03/14/2020.

Thank for your help.
Best regards,
Sandra

UPDATE:

If a receipt *BT34 Meal / BT50* and in Day Itinerary a *meal (lunch and/or dinner) BT40* is selected, an error message "Duplicate meals selected in receipt and day itinerary" should be displayed and the Expense Statement should not get submitted.

column1: EnBW - check of meal deduction rule
column26:
Within the statement 3914650 fixed meal deduction were calculated. This is wrong. No fixed meal deductions should have been calculated within this statement. It is a special constellation of per diems from Germany and Austria. The meal deductions from Austria and Germany were calculated for fixed meal deductions, too even if the absence is over 8 hours each day.

As EnBW is separating between fixed and relative meal deduction the rule for the calculation needs to be reviewed. Martin Rohkamm suggested that several Links to the Engine were changed in the meantime.

Attached you find the wrong statement and the rule out of the custom logic.

column291: 09/Jul/20 1:55 PM;tuemce;[~decarvalho] What do you expect on which position exactly? I couldn't reproduce this on Bali. Can you please attach also the whole request in a textfile?;;;
column292:
14/Jul/20 6:02 PM;decarvalho;Dear Olcay, please also check doc "case 2-14925393863" attached with full investigation.

Scenario:
Add entertainment receipt


3 participants internal + Partners “2 or more” = in report we can see “Participants are given separately” under “External participants” instead of participants names under “Internal participants”

!image-2020-07-14-12-59-05-516.png!

!image-2020-07-14-12-59-15-581.png!



In expense classic there was a check box to enable listing of participants separately. But this is not available in the user interface within expense GT anymore. But I already thought that this check box can maybe be set automatically, and no one will see it in the user interface, and this could cause an error. Or maybe it is so, that it is needed to set this check box in some statements, and it is not set and cannot be set.

This can be found

  <entry key="validation.Entertainment.5">net.ifao.expense.validation.expense.all.customValidators.cms.PartnerLinkToEntertainmentParticipantValidator</entry>

and it is relating to 

[https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine/browse/src/main/java/net/ifao/expense/validation/expense/all/customValidators/cms/PartnerLinkToEntertainmentParticipantValidator.java]

 

The customer is complaining that there are some cases where the participants are not listed on the report itself, but with a remark that they are listed separately.

It seems, if 2 or more partners is selected, the check box which is not visible anymore in GT, is activated automatically and this needs to be change. I think, there is still a link between the old validation and/or check box and 2 partners and more. Might be caused by this config from the vegas configuration file of the system (please see attachment):

!image-2020-07-14-12-57-27-580.png!
Here is a value set to true as soon as for this kind of receipt 2 or more partners is selected.

This could be the trigger to use this validation rule / check box.;;;

column1: TUI-CHANGE IN CONFIGURATION:TRAINEE MEAL DEDUCTIONS
column26:
*TBS trainees* get a reduced per diem rate (they get only 30% from the regular rate ).
reduction is 70% -> amount left is 30% from absolute value so they trainees get a total of 30% perdiem.This applies to all countries they select in the absence for trainees.

These are identified by choosing the "ACTIVITY: Trainee Management development"

 *the meals basis should be changed and it should be based in their perdiem reduction* and not the maximum . So the basis has to be corrected to their perdiem rate

meal deducted breakfast: 9eur (lunch0 +dinner 0)–< *{color:#FF0000}but here breakfast should be  1.80eur{color}*

column1: MSG - replacing Umlaute function not working

Function to replace umlauts in the export had been implemented for systems msg-life and msg when CI-3379 had been implemented to fix the export.

column291:
11/May/20 9:25 PM;salajan;Hi Nuria,

After multiple checks and verifying the configuration/market template used it seems the behavior is normal.

The difference between debit and credit posting lines comes from a German statutory rule (Sachbezugswerte) and happened because _+*the user deducted a meal on a day when he did not receive any per diem.*+_
This can easily be seen in the PDF I am attaching (corresponds to the statement you mentioned and has posting lines at the end.

In reality, a Wage posting line should be created but during the integration with SAP we were told no such lines are necessary.

Now, I understand that debit and credit need to be made equal so:
 * we can either consider 0 when users deduct meals on days when they are not allocated any per diem. This would simply ignore such deductions.
 * *or* we can integrate these deductions in the posting lines so users can end-up paying money to the company.

Hope this helps, let me know if there are any questions about the functioning of the German statutory regulations and waiting for your decision.;;;
